If you are looking to make life-changing gains from #Crypto, you still have a lot of opportunities.
 
Remember, in crypto, there are no such things as too low or too high.
 
Back in 2021, when #SOL was trading at $2.

People said that it had a maximum 10x potential given the market size.
 
The same happened with #MATIC, FTM, SHIB, #DOGE, AXS, and many other tokens.
 
People called their top at 10x, then 20x, and even 50x.
 
In the end, they all pulled a 𝟭𝟬𝟬𝘅-𝟭𝟱𝟬𝘅 in just 1 year.
 
Right now, a lot of people are waiting for new lows in their favourite alts, and in most cases, it will probably not happen.
 
So, the best thing is to DCA in when there is a dip and DCA out when there are big pumps.
 
If you play the next 2 years with a good strategy, you will be rich.
 
I'll also find gem coins for you and put them on your radar, but in the end, it all depends on your strategy.

Today marks the beginning of a week of major announcements 💣

From day one, we decided that RHO would be for everyone, for SOLANA!

It would be pointless to tell you about free mint if you end up paying fees🙌

What we offer is transparent and all-inclusive, including the fees of the open protocols.

We always prioritized transparency, we developed our concept and our tech around sustainability, to create something accessible to all without compromising quality⭐️

No presales or allow lists were made; instead, we opted for gamification to make the mint more engaging while still keeping it open to everyone. 

That being said, here is the mint price of RHO for the various tiers.

As you may have seen from our conceptual map, this is how the mint will unfold: 
https://t.co/DYKemj4YoL

We hope this meets your expectations, and for any doubts, this will be the week to clear them up.🦾

Tomorrow, a post dedicated entirely to our Tokenomics system in detail will be released. 

Are you RHOdy? 🚀

Here are more details of WINR Protocol's third chain expansion on Fantom after Arbitrum and the upcoming Solana launch.

The protocol tech stack, including WINR Account Abstraction, WINR VRF, and WINR games, will be deployed on Fantom and utilized by https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk. https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk will be the first-ever white-label user of the protocol on Fantom.

https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk is operated by a completely separate team, and they will receive all of the upcoming games launching on the protocol, including Unity-based table games and +10 Unity-based grid slot games based on massively popular slots around web2 that generate the most revenue and acquire the highest amount of users, starting next month.

https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk will operate a private version of the WINR Liquidity Pool engine, and while all of the smart contracts will be verified and transparent, they will be running a private bankroll.

The new budget system that WINR Labs has been working on has been battle-tested on https://t.co/URs0kbO2ur, will work as the accounting model for the bankroll, determining the revenue on each epoch to distribute a part of the revenue of https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk to WINR stakeholders. After each weekly epoch, 20% of all the profits generated by the platform will be distributed on Arbitrum, adding to the daily revenue being shared.

The budget model has also been implemented to permissionless frontend operators framework and Solana codebase, which is on ongoing audit with OtterSec (@osec_io). More details on this will become available on this Friday's monthly dev update, including deployment of WINR VRF on @XAI_GAMES with more partnerships coming with the gaming projects that will utilize the fastest random number generation on any EVM.

Today, we'll explore solana's premier liquidity protocol, and understand its inner workings.

@MeteoraAG is a key player in Solana's liquidity landscape, focused on creating a secure, sustainable yield layer for Solana DeFi. Their DLMM protocol empowers Solana protocols to manage liquidity dynamically.

DLMM addresses key issues of traditional liquidity pools like capital inefficiency, impermanent loss, limited flexibility, and high slippage. It allows liquidity concentration within specific price ranges, optimizing capital utilization and reducing impermanent loss risks.

DLMM operates by organizing liquidity into discrete price bins, offering precise liquidity concentration without slippage. Users can choose from three main strategies: Spot, Curve, and Bid-Ask, each catering to different market conditions and LP preferences.

The key features of DLMM include precise liquidity concentration, flexibility in volatility strategy selection, and dynamic fees to capitalize on market volatility. However, users must be aware of impermanent loss, complexity, price range selection, market volatility, and protocol risks associated with DLMM.

In conclusion, while DLMM introduces complexities and risks, it also offers innovative solutions to enhance liquidity provision on Solana. Meteora's commitment to improving efficiency and profitability through DLMM is commendable, making it a promising tool for Solana DeFi growth.

If you'd like to know more about meteora's DLMM, then you should check out this indepth and more detailed medium article I penned down: https://t.co/ucneYWPEcj

 #MeteoraDLMM

Here are more details of WINR Protocol's third chain expansion on Fantom after Arbitrum and the upcoming Solana launch.

The protocol tech stack, including WINR Account Abstraction, WINR VRF, and WINR games, will be deployed on Fantom and utilized by https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk. https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk will be the first-ever white-label user of the protocol on Fantom.

https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk is operated by a completely separate team, and they will receive all of the upcoming games launching on the protocol, including Unity-based table games and +10 Unity-based grid slot games based on massively popular slots around web2 that generate the most revenue and acquire the highest amount of users, starting next month.

https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk will operate a private version of the WINR Liquidity Pool engine, and while all of the smart contracts will be verified and transparent, they will be running a private bankroll.

The new budget system that WINR Labs has been working on has been battle-tested on https://t.co/URs0kbO2ur, will work as the accounting model for the bankroll, determining the revenue on each epoch to distribute a part of the revenue of https://t.co/QukVbUMuYk to WINR stakeholders. After each weekly epoch, 20% of all the profits generated by the platform will be distributed on Arbitrum, adding to the daily revenue being shared.

The budget model has also been implemented to permissionless frontend operators framework and Solana codebase, which is on ongoing audit with OtterSec (@osec_io). More details on this will become available on this Friday's monthly dev update, including deployment of WINR VRF on @XAI_GAMES with more partnerships coming with the gaming projects that will utilize the fastest random number generation on any EVM.

✨Star Atlas Crew - @Solana's Next Generation Of PFPs 🚀

Crew are the foundation for all activities within the @StarAtlas metaverse !🌌

Who's ready for a Star Atlas Crew Airdrop?!?

Currently Known Info On Star Atlas Crew:🧐
🔸Crew will be coming in the form of Crew Packs
🔸Crew will also be a PFP
🔸Players will be airdropped Crew Packs for the amount of crew slots their ships have at the time the snapshot is taken
🔸The snapshot has not been taken yet
🔸1 Crew member for each crew slot
🔸You will be able to buy crew packs
🔸There will be a way to get 1 free crew member when players download the Companion App
🔸The first wave of crew members airdropped to players will be primary MUD
🔸In the future ships will not come with crew
🔸There are chances of anomaly level crew members in future packs
🔸Players can onboard by getting a level 0 crew member for free, after leveling it up, if the player wants to sell or trade the crew, or get into the economy the player will have to mint the crew member/s

🔸Crew will upgrade Star Atlas into a Role-Playing-Game as you can play with every crew member
🔸Universal crew rewards
🔸Mobile Crew XP
🔸Crew members have different: Personalities, back stories, aptitudes, rarities, levels
🔸Every crew member will have their one backstory that's based on where they were born within the Galia Expanse lore, events, planets, political groups, where & who they trained under...
🔸Rarity is tied to the aptitudes
🔸The level rarity of a crew member applies to how well they will perform their assigned roles
🔸Crew members' will have unique personalities and traits based off the Ocean methodology (timeline unknown).
🔸Personalities will impact future game mechanics and are categorized into 5 major traits of the human condition:
             ▪️Openness to experience
             ▪️Conscientiousness
             ▪️Extraversion
             ▪️Agreeableness
             ▪️Neuroticism
🔸Getting the correct crew, with every different species, with traits and personalities that work well with one another could give ships additional buffs
🔸7 aptitudes (crew inclinations) apply to 14 different roles
🔸Different buffs for different roles based on crew members aptitude (flight aptitude = buff for flight roles)
🔸Major & minor aptitudes are linked with crew member rarity and quality
🔸Aptitudes will significantly improve how the crew member will perform and how fast they improve in the areas where they have an aptitude in game
🔸Crew members don't get weapons for free but this is tied to the crew app
🔸Move to progress your crew member training and getting items, weapons and accessories that will influence crew stats in-game

Today, we'll explore solana's premier liquidity protocol, and understand its inner workings.

@MeteoraAG is a key player in Solana's liquidity landscape, focused on creating a secure, sustainable yield layer for Solana DeFi. Their DLMM protocol empowers Solana protocols to manage liquidity dynamically.

DLMM addresses key issues of traditional liquidity pools like capital inefficiency, impermanent loss, limited flexibility, and high slippage. It allows liquidity concentration within specific price ranges, optimizing capital utilization and reducing impermanent loss risks.

DLMM operates by organizing liquidity into discrete price bins, offering precise liquidity concentration without slippage. Users can choose from three main strategies: Spot, Curve, and Bid-Ask, each catering to different market conditions and LP preferences.

The key features of DLMM include precise liquidity concentration, flexibility in volatility strategy selection, and dynamic fees to capitalize on market volatility. However, users must be aware of impermanent loss, complexity, price range selection, market volatility, and protocol risks associated with DLMM.

In conclusion, while DLMM introduces complexities and risks, it also offers innovative solutions to enhance liquidity provision on Solana. Meteora's commitment to improving efficiency and profitability through DLMM is commendable, making it a promising tool for Solana DeFi growth.

If you'd like to know more about meteora's DLMM, then you should check out this indepth and more detailed medium article I penned down: https://t.co/ucneYWPEcj

 #MeteoraDLMM

Restaking is expanding beyond Ethereum.

The top 4 current frontrunners 👇

• @babylon_chain's Bitcoin Staking Protocol.

Babylon allows #BTC to be used for staking in Proof-of-Stake blockchains, increasing their security without the need of inflationary native token rewards while giving yield on native #BTC.

Thanks to restaking, BTC won't be just hard money, but will become a productive asset.

• @LinearProtocol: Stake $NEAR, get $LiNEAR LST token.

Linear will launch $bLiNEAR (boosted LiNEAR) Liquid Restaked Token (LRT) and holders of $LNR token will decide which services will be validated.

$LNR airdr0p coming soon with a lock-drop campaign.

Two other protocols I've shared before, but here's a recap:

• @oct_network $OCT: Restaking on Near.

Appchains in the Octopus Network scale their security using LPoS (Leased Proof-of-Stake) and @ottochain_ is the first appchain launched.

Unlike Linear, restaking NEAR to Octopus won't give you a liquid restaked token, so your staked NEAR can't be further used in DeFi.

• @Picasso_Network $PICA is bringing restaking for Solana, Polkadot, Ethereum and other chains.

Picasso just launched LST for $DOT, $lsDOT which will be used for restaking to secure @ComposableFin network (first bridging and later other middleware infra and dApps).

Restaking for Solana will support SOL, mSOL, jitoSOL, and LP tokens.

This bill, sponsored by Senator Bostar (@BostarEliot), adds Nebraska to the forefront of states advocating for your right to self-custody, purchase, use, spend #Bitcoin, and crucially, to mine and run a Bitcoin node! You can read more about the bill below.

This Nebraska bill builds on the foundational work of Congressman Mike Flood (@USRepMikeFlood) before he graduated to Washington, DC. We are thankful for his leadership in this arena.

We Need Your Voice: Volunteer for #Bitcoin Advocacy

We plan to introduce 13 bills in 13 different states (at least) in 2024. Each time a bill is introduced, lawmakers in the state often hold a hearing to receive input from the public.

And this is where your assistance will be invaluable.

You can volunteer to provide written or verbal testimony in support of these pro-#Bitcoin bills!

By volunteering to provide written or verbal testimony, you play a direct role in the passage of these transformative laws. We need individuals like you to step up and support these bills. Please sign up now to be added to our short list of volunteers!

Don't miss this opportunity to be part of a pivotal moment in Bitcoin's journey. Together we can pass pro-#Bitcoin bills across the USA.

Those laws will protect your right to self-custody, mine, and run a node. They will also eliminate state level capital gains on your #Bitcoin transactions under $200!

Sessions are ramping up as we speak, so please do not wait to throw your name in the hat. Once you have signed up share this link with others you know who can help us: https://t.co/3sIWmselVV

As we embark on this journey to secure your #Bitcoin rights, your support and involvement are invaluable. With each state that passes these laws, we come closer to realizing a future where Bitcoin is not just accepted, but protected and embraced.

Full statement from G. Gensler:

Today, the Commission approved the listing and trading of a number of spot bitcoin exchange-traded product (ETP) shares.

I have often said that the Commission acts within the law and how the courts interpret the law. Beginning under Chair Jay Clayton in 2018 and through March 2023, the Commission disapproved more than 20 exchange rule filings for spot bitcoin ETPs. One of those filings, made by Grayscale, contemplated the conversion of the Grayscale Bitcoin Trust into an ETP.

We are now faced with a new set of filings similar to those we have disapproved in the past. Circumstances, however, have changed. The U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia held that the Commission failed to adequately explain its reasoning in disapproving the listing and trading of Grayscale’s proposed ETP (the Grayscale Order).[1] The court therefore vacated the Grayscale Order and remanded the matter to the Commission. Based on these circumstances and those discussed more fully in the approval order, I feel the most sustainable path forward is to approve the listing and trading of these spot bitcoin ETP shares.

The Commission evaluates any rule filing by a national securities exchange based upon whether it is consistent with the Exchange Act and regulations thereunder, including whether it is designed to protect investors and the public interest. The Commission is merit neutral and does not take a view on particular companies, investments, or the assets underlying an ETP. If the issuer of a security and the listing exchange comply with the Securities Act, the Exchange Act, and the Commission’s rules, that issuer must be provided the same access to our regulated markets as anyone else.

Importantly, today’s Commission action is cabined to ETPs holding one non-security commodity, bitcoin. It should in no way signal the Commission’s willingness to approve listing standards for crypto asset securities. Nor does the approval signal anything about the Commission’s views as to the status of other crypto assets under the federal securities laws or about the current state of non-compliance of certain crypto asset market participants with the federal securities laws. As I’ve said in the past, and without prejudging any one crypto asset, the vast majority of crypto assets are investment contracts and thus subject to the federal securities laws.[2]

Investors today can already buy and sell or otherwise gain exposure to bitcoin at a number of brokerage houses, through mutual funds, on national securities exchanges, through peer-to peer payment apps, on non-compliant crypto trading platforms, and, of course, through the Grayscale Bitcoin Trust. Today’s action will include certain protections for investors:

First, sponsors of bitcoin ETPs will be required to provide full, fair, and truthful disclosure about the products. Investors in any bitcoin ETP that is listed and traded will benefit from the disclosure included in public registration statements and required periodic filings. While these disclosures are required, it is important to note that today’s action does not endorse the disclosed ETP arrangements, such as custody arrangements.

Second, these products will be listed and traded on registered national securities exchanges. Such regulated exchanges are required to have rules designed to prevent fraud and manipulation, and we will monitor them closely to ensure that they are enforcing those rules. Furthermore, the Commission will fully investigate any fraud or manipulation in the securities markets, including schemes that use social media platforms.[3] Such regulated exchanges also have rules designed to address certain conflicts of interest as well as to protect investors and the public interest.

Further, existing rules and standards of conduct will apply to the purchase and sale of the approved ETPs. This includes, for example, Regulation Best Interest when broker-dealers recommend ETPs to retail investors, as well as a fiduciary duty under the Investment Advisers Act for investment advisers. Today’s action does not approve or endorse crypto trading platforms or intermediaries, which, for the most part, are non-compliant with the federal securities laws and often have conflicts of interest.

Third, Commission staff is separately completing the review of registration statements for 10 spot bitcoin ETPs simultaneously, which will help create a level playing field for issuers and promote fairness and competition, benefiting investors and the broader market.

Since 2004, this agency has had experience overseeing spot non-security commodity ETPs, such as those holding certain precious metals. That experience will be valuable in our oversight of spot bitcoin ETP trading.

Though we’re merit neutral, I’d note that the underlying assets in the metals ETPs have consumer and industrial uses, while in contrast bitcoin is primarily a speculative, volatile asset that’s also used for illicit activity including ransomware,[4] money laundering,[5] sanction evasion,[6] and terrorist financing.[7]

While we approved the listing and trading of certain spot bitcoin ETP shares today, we did not approve or endorse bitcoin. Investors should remain cautious about the myriad risks associated with bitcoin and products whose value is tied to crypto.

We have our #Bitcoin ETF! Here's why Ethereum is NOT next...

1) The Bitcoin ETF was very much a product of federal court pressure. Gary Gensler said so himself in today's statement announcing the approval:

But for Ethereum, all judicial roads still point to it being a clear unregistered security offering (even per the logic in the Ripple decision). However, Gensler flatly declared Bitcoin a commodity in his statement today, and signaled unregistered securities are not in any better position today than they were yesterday ; 

2) Proof of Stake is a very different creation/consensus mechanism than proof of work. Yield generation through PoS has a financialization aspect that proof of work mining simply does not have; and (perhaps most importantly)

3) the inclusion of “slashing” by consensus in a PoS model makes it ill-suited to ETF custody. Imagine, for example, having a completely legitimate paper ETF claim to Eth but your custodian is slashed for whatever reason—does your claim go away? Or are they obligated to buy again? Dunno, but that is not great in the eyes of regulators of retirement accounts and pensions

In short, Bitcoin is the outlier. Read my full paper on it here >> https://t.co/cTe02IuzlA

I can't quit thinking about Satoshi, Hal Finney, Ross Ulbricht and the countless others who gave up their identities, lives or freedom for this vision... a vision of a world with two forms of money:

the money of governments, and the money of the people

It's impartial money...

tamper-proof money...

money backed not by men but by math and algorithms...

an infrastructure run not by military might, jail cells and exorbitant privilege... but by incentives

When you launch a traditional Silicon Valley startup, you usually don't have to worry about hiding your identity, getting swatted, imprisoned or even assassinated

And yet, many of bitcoin's earliest devs looked at all those risks and said fuck it, let's build

We've lost so much freedom in the world... there's a camera on every street corner. Our phone's listen in our conversations, our bank accounts can get seized at any moment, our use of pronouns can destroy our careers and exile us into oblivion

Crypto is one of the only things on earth pushing back

It's the last free frontier on earth

We've built out uncensorable money. But more than that: uncensorable web storage, hosting, DNS, DEXes, gaming, appstores and more

Crypto is our escape

They've hemmed us in IRL, but they can't hem us in online

Satoshi, Hal and Ross showed us a path to freedom

It's our job to protect it ✊

Today’s decision by the @SECGov to approve a spot Bitcoin ETF is a significant step forward for digital assets in the United States. 

It's clear that the American people have a desire to invest in this new technology, and our laws and regulations should reflect and welcome that desire—not shun it like SEC Chair @GaryGensler has done for too long.

SEC Commissioner @HesterPeirce does not mince words. You are 100% correct and you are one of the reasons why many of us, including me, never gave up on the #Bitcoin #ETF effort.

"Today’s order does not undo the many harms created by the disparate treatment of spot bitcoin products."

"First, our arbitrary and capricious treatment of applications in this area will continue to harm our reputation far beyond crypto. Diminished trust from the public will inhibit our ability to regulate the markets effectively."

"Second, our disproportionate attention on these filings has diverted limited staff resources away from other mission critical work. Over ten years, likely millions of dollars of staff time has gone toward blocking these applications."

"Third, our actions here have muddied people’s understanding of what the SEC’s role is."

"Fourth, by failing to follow our normal standards and processes in considering spot bitcoin ETPs, we have created an artificial frenzy around them. Had these products come to market in the way other comparable products typically have, we would have avoided the circus atmosphere in which we now find ourselves."

"Fifth, we have alienated a generation of product innovators within our space."

#Bitcoin is being hoovered up by spot ETFs at a rapid clip. In just two days, BlackRock has acquired 11,439 coins. The entire field of ETF providers bought a total of 23,000 coins on Thursday and Friday alone. 

We know that there are some 1.8 million #BTC on all exchanges. Of course, not all of those are for sale. But let's assume that they are for sale, for a moment. 

If they were all for sale, at the current rate, the entire 1.8 million supply of Bitcoin on all exchanges will be gone in just 4 months. 4 months!

To phrase it another way, 23,000 coins is 25x the current daily issuance. It is 50x the daily issuance, post-halving. 

The world is about to witness what happens when demand shock meets supply shock.

To say there is no correlation between #Bitcoin and news events would be denial.

In fact, it has grown much more common for major negative or positive news events to have the opposite effect.

The launch of CME futures came just one day after the 2017 top, on December 18th, 2017.

The Coinbase IPO launch came on the day of the April 2021 top, April 14th.

An ETF launched that purchased CME futures contracts on October 19th, 2021, one day before near cycle top prices then.

The FTX collapse took place over 10 days from November 2nd - 12th, 2022. Marking the cycle bottom.

Silicon Valley Bank collapsed on March 10th, 2023, marking an exact local low.

The SEC declared 61 Altcoins as securities on June 6th, 2023, just before another local low.

And just recently, ETFs began trading on January 11th, 2024. 

So far this has marked a local high that has not been surpassed.

The events have been organized, scheduled to trap you.

Will this time be different? You decide

In my opinion, the analysis of the SEC in its approval of the spot Bitcoin ETFs all but guarantees an approval of a ETH spot ETF for the following reasons:

1. ETH Futures are already trading on the CME. 
2. The SEC has already approved ETH futures ETFs. 
3. The CME has identical surveillance sharing agreements for the BTC futures and ETH futures. 
4. The correlation of ETH futures to spot is over 90% (just like BTC). This is primary reason they approved the BTC spot etf. 

Therefore, it would be arbitrary and capricious to treat the eth futures and spot markets differently (See Grayscale v SEC)

5. The SEC doesn’t like to pick winners. I think they would prefer two digital asset spot ETFs rather than just one.

We have posted this 
#Bitcoin roadmap for this cycle on 31st Dec 2023. 

So far, it all looks like it's going according to plan:

1. Bullish momentum until ETF decision

2. Expected volatility and a possible correction in January

3. New ATH in 2024 after Halving (driven by mass adoption)

4. Based on past cycles a new ATH in Q3-4 2025

We have taken into account macroeconomic factors as well (recession, inflation). However, this is ultimately not a bad thing for Bitcoin. 
More and more people see (and will see once it's mass adopted) Btc as "digital gold" and an inflation proof asset that is a store of value in bad economic times. Therefore we do not believe that the current bull rund is about to end soon.

Many catalysts on the way are likely to further boost this bull run.

Our own opinion. Not financial advice. Feel free to disagree :)

In 15 years, has #bitcoin ever been amassed with this amount of intensity, with this amount of capital? No! Do not let the USD price fool you. Focus on what is happening with #btc itself. The USD is the age-old trick and Wall Street in particular has used this "price trick" on the public since its inception. I know. I've been a part of that machinery since 1986. 

Even other industries use the price trick on you, the regular public. Most people have heard the term in real estate called, "gentrification." That's when a previously rundown area of a town or city is suddenly bought up on the cheap and rebuilt for a different, higher class of buyer to come in at inflated prices. Many of the insiders in on this game will purposely run down an area first. They will pay politicians and the police in an area to NOT police, so crime rises. They will allow the homeless to proliferate, just to cause prices to first crash and create a mass exodus from the area. Then they swoop in, buy up properties dirt cheap and start their rebuilding. This is gentrification at its finest and this blueprint has been used for decades. 

#Bitcoin is going through this gentrification process right now. The game is to use the falling price to have you flee #Bitcoin land, all while they massively scoop up the property you're abandoning on the cheap. They will use the FTX liquidations and the Mt. Gox scare to have you run down the prices via your panic. Don't fall for the "price trick," this "gentrification" scam. They are buying. Don't you see below? 👇🏽

The halving is right around the corner. It's a presidential election year in the U.S. Interest rates will be lowered this year. Printing will begin to skyrocket again. Supply on exchanges are at the lowest levels in years and the hodl rate is at record highs. Don't you see? The #bitcoin wallets of their freshly formed entities (ETFs) are rising throughout all of this, in your face, and some of you are still bickering about $32k, $25k, market top, ETF dud, etc. You're not paying attention, anon, and they are counting on this, just like they always do. 

I'm dedicating myself to ensure that those who have eyes to see and ears to hear heed this message and don't get left behind. We get one chance at this. Only one chance to change the trajectory of our bloodline. 

#stackharder. Ignore price for now and don't stop. Don't you dare stop. 🙏🏽

$BTC #Crypto #Bitcoin https://t.co/Rzyw0SFPjg

If you support a blockchain (other than #BTC) that claims to be money, your project is f*cked. 

If the community around your chain is a "move fast and break things" type of community, they are necessarily centralized. You have to operate like a company to move this fast. No one will adopt a centralized coin as their money. 

On the other hand, if they do a fair launch like #Bitcoin's and move slowly, they will never catch up to BTC.

As an owner of #BTC, why would I move my funds to a less secure chain? Why would I buy a coin with less liquidity? Why would I switch to a coin with a smaller network of users and hope it catches up? I already hold the most liquid, most secure coin with the largest network effect. History does not support people ditching the dominant network for an upstart network. 

People like to bring up MySpace being overtaken by Facebook. This is an apples to oranges comparison because it cost NOTHING to spin up a Facebook account and still keep your MySpace account, which is what everyone did. Only when all of their friends moved to Facebook did they ditch MySpace. 

Money is different because any value stored in Bitcoin is value not stored in another coin. The same value cannot be stored in two assets at the same time. There is a cost to switching your money. 

People won't ditch Bitcoin en masse for any specific features (bells n whistles) of another project either. History supports those features migrating to Bitcoin, in the same way that the key breakthrough of ClubHouse did not cause an exodus from Twitter. Instead, it was copied and introduced as Twitter Spaces on the dominant platform. 

This is how Bitcoin will evolve over time. Owning it now is not only a call option on the collapse of the fiat system and the inevitable adoption of Bitcoin, it is also a call option on useful innovations from the crypto space.

It really is true that all roads lead to Bitcoin.

Many people have begun to ask me where to start their #Bitcoin rabbit hole journey. Fortunately, there is so much to choose from today. This was not the case 4 years ago. 

The following four books would be a good start in my opinion: 

The Bitcoin Standard by @saifedean is a must. It's the bible and should be the cornerstone of any #btc library. It is responsible for orange-pilling the majority of bitcoiners after the year 2017 or so. 

Proof of Money by @ProofOfMoney was such a joy I have gone through it twice. It helped sharpen my fundamental knowledge of BTC's amazing  characteristics and the laws that make it unbeatable. 

Bitcoin Evangelism by @BrianDeMint is truly one of the best places to start the journey in my opinion. It's thorough, fun to read and packed with pure signal. 

Bitcoin: Hard Money You Can't F*ck With by @GoingParabolic read like a novel that kept me on the edge of my seat. It's super fun and almost instantly turns one into a hardcore Bitcoiner. They all have their place. Get them. 

I use audio versions of these during my cardio and workout sessions. I use the kindle versions of these during my alone time, which I plan out each day. I use both versions during my frequent plane trips. This is why I usually get both versions when they are available. 

Once these are consumed there is another deeper level of reading I recommend, a level that will take you down into the esoteric depths of #bitcoin. I'll share that list one day as well. In the meantime, I hope this helps. 🙏🏽 #stackharder

🚨 Unpopular Opinion 🚨 

While self-custody is undeniably the ideal, adoption through the ETFs is a massive net GOOD for #bitcoin.

What people miss is that this is not @Fidelity or @BlackRock holding the underlying #BTC: the rights to these coins belong to thousands - eventually millions - of individual asset holders who are now financially invested in the success of the asset; many of whom were not before. Broadening ✨skin-in-the-game ✨ is KEY. Moreso than any technical advancement.

While cryptography provides technical seizure resistance to #bitcoin, adoption, i.e. ✨expanding the number of individual stakeholders ✨ (which the ETFs will do), provides social and political seizure resistance.

While many of you may yearn for the day that governments ATTEMPT to seize #Bitcoin and your self-custodied coins remain in your possession (and you become a fugitive from the law, unable to spend them, except for e.coli-filled unpasteurized milk and mediocre grass-fed beef at your local farmers’ market), I would prefer an alternative world where any attempt at government seizure results in mass outrage and a massive lawsuit led by BlackRock, Fidelity, $MSTR and millions of #bitcoin-invested stakeholders that simply stops the government in its tracks.

Seizure resistance is not just a technical feature of #bitcoin, but a social one as well. And social seizure resistance depends on as many people holding #bitcoin as possible, ETFs or not. The government is not all-powerful, and if you view them as such, you’ve already admitted the defeat of #bitcoin and sought refuge in the robustness of its marginalization.

IMO, #Bitcoin is one of the main reasons why decentralized peer-to-peer money has not yet been significantly adopted.

The #BTC protocol disincentives its use by design.

Who remembers when Steam adopted BTC and quickly stepped back due to high fees and long confirmation times? +

Steam made this "no longer supporting Bitcoin" announcement on December 6, 2017, when fees topped out at nearly $20/tx. 
https://t.co/J41bLBSF6R

Unsurprisingly, this wasn't even the worst moment for BTC since then.

In April 2021, fees reached an ATH of $62.78/tx on average. Followed by a peak at $31.14/tx in May 2023 and a higher one of $37.43/tx in December.

Personally, I believe this is just the beginning of a much worse scenario in the future.
https://t.co/7bTyx11ShK

Moreover, the gaming platform blamed price volatility amid a long waiting time to conclude the purchases. This is partially due to BTC's multiple needed confirmations in a 10-minute block interval.

Interestingly, the faster payments are fully settled (irreversibly), the less affected both peers (buyer and seller) are by volatility during the shopping experience.

We are long overdue to stop wasting time with Bitcoin and shift our focus to working with efficiently decentralized peer-to-peer money that solves these issues and incentivizes its use.

#nano is my favorite and the one that better addresses each of these problems, IMHO. That's why I invest my time educating people about its properties and benefits.

But more than just "educating," I already actively use nano on a daily basis. Trying to discover ways to effectively rely less on the fiat and banking systems, aiming for more self-sovereignty and better monetary tools with better economic fundamentals.
https://t.co/wR2nn6NBuy

However, even if you don't like $XNO for some reason, there are other projects available, like #monero, #bitcoincash, #litecoin, #dash, etc. Which are far better tools for decentralized peer-to-peer money than BTC could ever be.

Ignore the noise!
Focus on what really matters, which is utility.

At some point, the number of #BTC    being lost every year will be more than the annual production.

Each lost #bitcoin    is a donation to everyone else who holds BTC securely - the value of active coins increases ever so slightly as fewer coins are available to be bought.

I think we will see this around 2040, when there will be ~28 BTC produced per day, or about 10,000/year.

BITCOIN WILL RAISE THE WORLD'S PRODUCTIVITY AND STANDARD OF LIVING

In a bitcoinized world, which I believe will come upon us faster than most think, you're not going to get anyone to give up their precious #btc unless you deliver some service, product or good that is nothing short of amazing. Whstever you do, you'll have to do it better than most.

No one is going to hand over the most valuable asset in the world that continues to rise in value every four years for piss-poor work and inferior items. #Bitcoin is going up in value forever AND #Bitcoin solves inflation.

Send this to your friends.

Core understandings:

1) Money is the good with which we price in all other goods. Money by itself is worthless (if you had a bunch of money but couldn’t exchange it for anything, it is useless). Money is how we determine the value of other goods, this car is worth this much, a gallon of milk this much, and so on.

2) There will only ever be 21 million #Bitcoin 

Let’s say there are 100 money units in circulation in an economy. 

Everything in the economy is priced in those 100 money units. There are 5 houses, 10 cars, and 20 cows, among other goods. 

One house costs 1 money unit, one car costs 0.5 money units, and one cow costs 0.10 money units, which means all the houses together are worth 5 money units, cars 5 money units, and cows 2 money units. 

Let’s say the economy was able to increase the production of houses, cars, and cows through the labor of workers and technological advancement, such that there are now 10 houses, 20 cars, and 40 cows.

If there are still 100 money units in circulation, everything in the economy is still priced in those 100 money units.

The value of each house, car, and cow would go down because there are more of those goods available to the economy but the amount of money units in circulation has stayed the same.

For example, housing in total is still valued at 5 money units, but there are now 10 houses. That means each house is worth 0.5 money units vs the original 1 money unit.

This results in two things: 

1) Houses are more affordable as they have become more abundant, providing not only the economy’s inhabitants with more shelter, but the shelter itself has actually become cheaper, enabling more inhabitants to cost effectively purchase shelter, allowing more inhabitants to be protected from the environment, which allows more inhabitants to spend more time producing and providing value instead of having to worry about sheltering themselves, which would provide more resources to the economy to further boost the production of housing, which would further increase the supply of homes, allowing them to become even more abundant and even more cheaper.

2) Whereas 1 money unit used to be able to buy you only one house, now that the prosperity of the economy has gone up in the form of an increased supply of housing, 1 money unit can buy you two houses. This means that the money units have gone up in value, as they can buy you more things.

Here's the crazy part...

That's if the housing in total remains valued at 5 money units.

Remember, money is the good with which we price in all other goods. If we have a fixed amount of money, all the goods in the economy will always add up in value to the fixed amount of money.

Theoretically, and historically, over time, new goods emerge on the market to which the economic users value. In 2006, the iPhone didn't exist. In 2007, the iPhone existed.

In this fixed 100 money unit scenario, as housing becomes more abundant in supply, the price of each home goes down.

But as new goods arise, such as the iPhone, value from still that fixed 100 money unit supply gets pulled out of previous goods and placed into the new goods.

The value that is to be assigned to new goods has to come from somewhere. 

In a fixed supply of money, that value gets extracted from previous goods and assigned to the new goods, lowering the price of previous goods even further.

In the 100 money unit scenario, new goods will emerge, and value will get extracted from previous goods, in this case, housing, and placed into the new goods.

This means that not only are there more houses represented by the same 100 money units (because of the increase in production), which drives the price of each house down, but there are new goods that emerge in the economy to which people give value to, which means value previously assigned to housing now gets allocated to the new goods, which further drives down the total value of housing and the price of a home, which further increases abundance, which further increases the prosperity of the economy and its inhabitants, which further increases the purchasing power of each money unit.

This is why #Bitcoin is going up in value forever.

There are only 21 million bitcoins that will ever be in existence. 

Everything in the world will be priced in those 21 million bitcoins.

As the world provides more production and prosperity in the form of labor and technological advancement, the supply of goods becomes more abundant.

Because the goods are more abundant, but the fixed amount of 21 million bitcoins remains, the price of each of those goods goes down, which increases the purchasing power of each unit of bitcoin.

As time goes on, this trend will continue as society further advances technology, which further increases the output of humanity, making goods more abundant and creating new goods which have value, which brings the price of all other goods down, which further increases the purchasing power of each unit of bitcoin.

This is also how #Bitcoin solves inflation.

Inflation occurs because new money is created and the rate of that new money creation outpaces the growth in production.

Prices go up because the supply of money goes up.

While the prices of goods should be going down in accordance with the increase in production and abundance, in an inflationary monetary system, this is not the case, because those goods are priced in an increasing amount of money.

Inflation is both robbing the production of humanity and robbing the purchasing power of the money, making life more expensive in the process.

Have you ever wondered...

If humanity is producing more and better things and advancing technology, how is life getting more expensive?

The pricing of that increase in production in an inflationary monetary system is how life is getting more expensive.

Notice the graph below. Pricing housing in the inflationary monetary system (the U.S. Dollar) results in the price increasing, making homes less affordable. Pricing housing in the fixed supply, *deflationary* monetary system (Bitcoin) results in the price decreasing, making homes more affordable.

#Bitcoin is the solution. #Bitcoin is the fixed supply monetary system humanity has been waiting for.

We can now accurately price in our advancements in technology and increases in production, allowing life to become more affordable AND allowing our money to grow in value forever.

This is why they say infinity divided by 21 million #Bitcoin .

The possible production, technological advancement, and prosperity humanity can create is infinite. How much prosperity will have been created in 250,000 years? We can't possibly know the answer other than that it's infinite.

Prosperity is infinite, but there will only ever be 21 million #Bitcoin to price in that prosperity.

What is infinity divided by any number?

Infinity.

#Bitcoin is going up in value forever.

Happy one year anniversary! 🎉

Exactly a year ago, the OCM Genesis collection was immortalized on Bitcoin. Its inscription number (20219) magically matched the year and month when OCM was launched: 2021 September.

The last year has been a transformative year for Bitcoin. Many builders are pushing the boundaries of what's possible on Bitcoin with their creations. Inscription 20219 was one of those, a parent inscription for a collection with the art of all 10,000 unique OCM Genesis, distributed with recursive children.

Today, Recursive Inscriptions and Parent-Child Provenance have evolved from mere ideas to established practices in Ordinals — a remarkable journey in just a year's time! 🔥

There will come a day when no Bitcoiner will accept any amount of government fiat trash for any amount of their #BTC.

That’s hyper-Bitcoinization. A day when trust in decentralized digital gold surpasses the crumbling faith in worthless printed paper. It's not just a shift in assets, it's a paradigm shift in belief systems. And it may coming sooner than we think. 

In this new era, #Bitcoin isn't just a new form of money, it's a statement, a way of life, a loud rejection of the traditional financial system's shortcomings. This is the future we are steadily moving towards, steadily, patiently, unrelenting, one block at a time. 

Onward and upward. 🚀🚀🚀

Revolutionizing Bitcoin DeFi, From BitVM to Ordiswap 🧪:

→ Ordiswap 🧪 is proud to be the 1st ever dApp in #BTC history that has ported over EVM logic on native #Bitcoin L1 🧡

→ One of the biggest advancements in the BTC space was the release of the BitVM whitepaper in October 2023, by developer Robin Linus. It highlighted new ways to implement dynamic smart contracts using the existing L1 infrastructure.

→ Prior to this, Taproot upgrade, and the launch of Ordinals, BRC-20 standards in 2023, have unleashed a flurry of builder interest in Bitcoin — catalyzing fresh momentum in network activity ❌. But, transactions were limited over marketplaces + OTC. DeFi still needed expressive smart contracts, and the Bitcoin L1 had limited technical capabilities on that front.

→ 📜 The BitVM thesis aimed to implement dynamic smart contracts by scaling complex computations off-chain, and enabling participants to settle with the Bitcoin code smoothly, and resolve in case of disputes. 💡 Think Optimistic Rollups on Ethereum. BitVM requires no modifications on the Bitcoin consensus rules and are based almost exclusively on existing primitives like hashlocks and timelocks.

→ Until now, there have been no working BitVM implementations, as all “Bitcoin-native DeFi” have either relied on L2s or rollups.

→ Ordiswap 🧪 changes all of this. BTCFi starts today.

Dissecting Ordiswap’s Tech ⚙️:

→ Ordiswap expands on the concept of “off-chain balance states” — a novel mechanism that manages user balances and interactions with periodic settlements on Bitcoin. These transactions inherit the security and finality of Bitcoin.

→ Ordiswap's AMM leverages @Uniswap v2's constant product formula to ensure fairness and efficiency in token trades with minimized slippage. Users can create pools in a permissionless manner, provide liquidity and stake to earn yields.

→ Ordiswap is thus the 1st protocol to also enable LP tokens to exist on native #Bitcoin 💧

→ There is seamless interoperability with the EVM ecosystem, with cross-chain swaps enabled via the highly liquid @THORChain pools. No bridges, no L2s, no problem.

What Does This Unlock 🔓❓

→ An efficient, low-slippage, interoperable infrastructure which will allow a thousand DeFi primitives to bloom on Bitcoin. Expect yield farms, decentralized lending markets etc.

→ Ordiswap LP tokens can be plugged into all different types of DeFi applications, opening up a whole new world of composability and network effects. The first step to the BTCfi summer? 🌞

→ No more fractured liquidity. With easy avenues to bridge to L1, liquidity is coming home to Bitcoin. No more reliance on marketplaces or over-the-counter (OTC) trades.

Ordiswap, a Full-Stack Bitcoin Infrastructure Behemoth 🔄:

→ Ordiswap goes beyond just an AMM, but rather an enitre emerging full-stack infrastructure ecosystem for Bitcoin DeFi that aims to completely redefine liquidity dynamics on the native layer.

→ Ordilayer, a proprietary Layer-2 designed for future proof scalability and applications

→ Ordipad, a BRC-20 launchpad, with token launches accessible to $ORDS & $REOS holders

→ BTSD, an over-collateralized & decentralized stablecoin that implements aspects of successful stability models like @MakerDAO

→ Ordiswap Foundation, and much more...

→ AMM Stage 2 Build coming very soon 👀

Try out our live Stage 1 build on BTC Mainnet: ⚡ https://t.co/GooVlmUMhx

The same exact pattern for #Bitcoin has played itself out in every cycle with the 20 Week EMA.

Recently, during the pullback to $38,500, price narrowly missed a retest of the moving average as support, a false retest.

But a closer look at the cycles shows that every single one has experienced this, in an even larger 6-step pattern:

1. Price breaks above the moving average and goes on its first run of the cycle

2. Price breaks below the moving average after the completion of the first run

3. Price breaks above again, marking the first true rally

4. Price creates a false retest of support where it narrowly misses the moving average

5.  A second run takes place (We are here)

6. Bitcoin finally makes a true retest of the Moving average as support

According to this measure, maybe the full correction does not need to be as deep while the moving average sits at just $40,000.

Sideways price action is typical after the true retest.

#Bitcoin is trading above the 0.618 level 🤔

Historically, Bitcoin has never closed above the 0.618 in any of the previous cycle before the halving event on a weekly chart.

This area as acted as a strong resistance zone & is the last area of problem before reaching the ATH.

The 0.618 level is currently sitting at $48,500. If $BTC closes this weekly candle above it, this will be the first time ever price breaking above 0.618 level before the Halving.

If this happens, it will be extremely bullish for Bitcoin

#Bitcoin is the breaker of models. One model we have right now that I think is going to be broken sooner than most realize is the 4-year bull/bear cycle. Eventually, #BTC is going to go on a prolonged bull run. I can see it happening from 2028 onward.

I don't think people appreciate how early we are. They see a trillion dollar market cap and think it's a lot. It's not. We're at less than 1% adoption. What happens when this number quintuples? What happens when it's 25%? It will stabilize price quite a bit.

Once we reach the inflection point on the adoption curve, adoption will skyrocket upward. Add this to a halving or two and it's going to be very hard for bears to maintain selling pressure for very long.

Bitcoin is also ossifying against attacks. There will be future attacks to be sure, but BTC gets more resilient after each attack, and future attacks will become more and more pathetic. They won't have the same effect on price as past attacks.

This phenomenon will be the impetus for hyperbitcoinization. Once that happens, it will likely only go up in proportion to gains in productivity and population growth. Hodl on until we get there.

Interesting #Bitcoin    Fact:

On August 15, 2010, due to a bug in #BTC   's code, a transaction created 184 billion btc in block 74638. This event was dubbed the "value overflow incident." It was solved by the Bitcoin community with a soft fork that invalidated the extra #btc    and quickly restored the blockchain to its intended state. This would be the last and final time the #Bitcoin    protocol would see an interruption. It fixed the problem forever. 

This Is My Take:

I believe to this very day that this was planned by Satoshi Nakamoto. Here me out on this. 👇🏽

You see, 40 years earlier to the very day, President Richard Nixon announced the suspension of the convertibility of the U.S. dollar into gold. He did that on August 15, 1971. 🤯 This decision effectively ended the Bretton Woods system of international financial exchange and led to the transition to the global fiat currency system.m we know today. This event is commonly referred to as the “Nixon Shock.”

I believe Satoshi wanted to remind us what #Bitcoin    is here to solve a d chose this historical "fist" day to demonstrate that #Bitcoin    fixes the "Nixon shock." Once #BTC    fixed it, it would never be dow and never have a single hiccup for a single second, ever again.

I could be off my rocker, but I really don't think so. What I've grown to realize is that Satoshi Nakamoto did nothing without deep meaning. Every number, every choice, every decision is infused with deep meaning. I believe this inflation bug on the very day massive inflation was born is not a coincidence. It's not by chance. Satoshi was this careful and purposeful.

That's my 2 sats, and I'm sticking with it. What are your thoughts? 👇🏽

Satoshi emails on the tl today. I’ll tell you who I think it is👇

While Hal Finney is the Bitcoin bull case, I’ve spent years digging into the origin of Satoshi. I’ve read everything I could find and watched countless shows and even foreign documentaries about this topic. I remain pretty convinced that Satoshi is Paul Le Roux.

Main evidence being the fact that Satoshi went dark literally right before Le Roux was apprehended in Liberia. Satoshi was very active in emails, forum and newsgroups. Never to be heard from again.

Le Roux of course is in prison for multiple major crimes. And will be at least for the next 20 years. He did go on a rant about Bitcoin at his sentencing hearing a few years ago.

Bitcoin client contained a poker source code. Le Roux worked as a dev at an offshore gambling operation in Costa Rica prior to moving to the Philippines. About the same time Bodog did.

I think Le Roux worked for Bodog in Costa Rica which would have connected him with CSW. Not entirely sure but recall reading about that connection somewhere at one point.

In Philippines during the first year or two of Bitcoin when Satoshi mined over a million coins, Le Roux was questioned about his extraordinary power use.

This is covered in a Philippines public television network show about Le Roux. Had nothing to do with Satoshi. It was about his plotting of a murder of a local real estate agent there. They probably thought he was growing marijuana or something. But the times line up to when those coins were mined.

Le Roux developed E4M encryption software. And rumored to have been a part of TrueCrypt, which to this day forms the base of the encryption software used by terrorist groups like Al Queda for private messaging. It hasn’t been cracked.

Both of these softwares are open source, just like Bitcoin. I’m not a coder, but ones I have spoken to say that both E4M and the Bitcoin source code are highly advanced C++.

Apparantly there’s not a whole lot of people capable of coding either. Elon Musk was rumored to be Satoshi at one point simply due to his C++ coding skill. Not many exist that are capable of coding something like Bitcoin.

Bitcoin was coded between the time that Le Roux shut down his affiliate program network. Likely because of troubles with credit card processing. Same as he experienced in the gambling business. Giving him the motivation to explore digital currencies as a form of payment. Which is the thesis of the Bitcoin whitepaper. Transfer of digital cash for payments. Not digital gold like the new narrative.

Circumstantially, if you read Le Roux’s ramblings on usenet going back all the way into the 90s, he’s quite libertarian and uses the same style of half British, half American English that Satoshi does. Time zones of posts match up also to somebody that would have been living in the Philippines at the time of most activity.

Satoshi was a prolific poster with a similar flair of arrogance as Le Roux had on newsgroups when touting E4M. And then Satoshi just stopped posting. Very out of character.

Le Roux also was found with a fake passport with the name “Solotoshi”. Which doesn’t prove anything but is an interesting coincidence.

There’s alot more. And you can easily fall down this rabbit hole like I did. There’s no actual smoking gun here but I feel like Le Roux had the very specific C++ supercoder skills that not many possess, and the motivation after struggling with online payments always, plus the mindset of a very extreme libertarian.

Ethereum has gas fees, Solana breaks, Avalanche breaks, Bitcoin belongs to BlackRock.

Almost laughable at this point.

Not throwing shade, just stating facts.

In the 2015-2017 cycle, Bitcoin peaked 518 days after the Halving

In the 2019-2021 cycle, Bitcoin peaked 546 days after the Halving

If history repeats and the next Bull Market peak occurs 518-546 days after the Halving...

That would mean Bitcoin could peak in this cycle in mid-September or mid-October 2025

Currently, Bitcoin is accelerating in this cycle by approximately 210 days

So the longer Bitcoin consolidates after the Halving, the better it will be for resynchronising this current cycle with the traditional Halving cycle

🌛🌛🌛Altcoins Analysis 🌜🌜🌜

As far as the #Altcoin market goes you are still quite early. Why? Purely because #BTC.D is still very high. This means the #altcoin market hasn’t even started the ‘mania phase’ yet.

The  ‘mania phase’ begins when #BTC.D starts to drop sharply. This occurs when market participants are willing to take on more risk and liquidity moves into #altcoins from #Bitcoin, stable coins and fiat. This increases the market caps of #altcoins thus reducing #BTC.D. 

This doesn’t mean #Bitcoin’s price drops. Quite the contrary as #Bitcoin will continue in its own ‘mania phase’ to the upside. What it means is, as dominance falls and liquidity flows into #alts the market is willing to take on more risk. Hence the reason why #BTC.D is always very low at the peak of every market or the end of any ‘mania phase’. 

This metric is actually a good indicator to signal a potential market top. As you can see in the chart during every market top #BTC.D has been within a range of 35-39%. 

What this chart is telling us now is #BTC.D is beginning to top out and it will soon begin its decline to the downside. I still think we might have a little more upside before this capitulation of dominance begins. Possibly 58%. 

Either way my view is that we are very close to the beginnings of a big #altseason and indeed the ‘mania phase’. 

At Caesar Capital we will be watching very closely if/when #BTC.D enters the ‘Death Zone’ on the chart below as this could be a strong indication of a market top.

@ElastosInfo will turn every blockchain into a #Bitcoin Layer2 using its BTC Oracle. $ELA has been merged-mined with Bitcoin since 2018. 28mill total by 2105, price today is $4.15 ($91mill MK) - available on Coinbase, Kucoin, Gate, Crypto. com and Uniswap.

How?
- The #BTC Oracle acts as a Zero Knoweldge Proof (ZPK) data feed that provides real-time Bitcoin information to smart contracts (EVM Contract) on a blockchain.

- It inputs various types of Bitcoin-related information, such as transfer, ordinals, and TxScripts information, which could be used by decentralised applications (dApps) for functions like BTC Lending, BRC20 Indexing, Algorithmic Stable Coin issuance.

- The EVM (Ethereum Virtual Machine) Contract interacts with this data uses ZKPs (Zero-Knowledge Proofs) to verify the integrity and correctness of the data without revealing underlying information.

There are three main layers:
1) Application Layer (dApps like WBTC, Lending, Stablecoin) – Provides various decentralised services on any blockchain.

2) $ELA Relayers Network – Acts as the execution layer, ensuring that transactions are correctly executed and liquidated when necessary. They act as guardians of transactions.

3) #BTC Oracle Network – Generates ZKPs and Transmits events from BTC to the EVM contract, allowing off-chain data (like Bitcoin price) to influence smart contract operations. This is facilitated through ZK Proofs and a One Time Sign mechanism.

On long term value in Bitcoin Ordinals 👇

Bitcoin is valuable long term because it is a STANDARD for a fungible digital asset. The whole world knows and can agree on what a bitcoin is, and how it works.
Ordinals can be long term valuable for a nonfungible digital asset if it becomes a STANDARD. First, it is *extremely* hard to build anything on top of Bitcoin because of Bitcoin's limited programmability, and even harder to create a standard on top of Bitcoin.

Casey has pulled off a miracle in standardizing a few things to create Ordinals. To understand what is actually long term valuable, it's important to understand what has been standardized. Not everything about Ordinals is a STANDARD, and anything that is not standard will have a sharp decline in value in the long term.
Take the concept of a Collection. The standard way to create a collection in Ordinals took over a year to implement and get the market to adopt, and this was pushed hard by Casey, the creator of Ordinals, and many market participants. That collection standard of Ordinals is Parent-Child Provenance.

To create a new collection standard and to get the whole world to adopt it as a new STANDARD in Ordinals is unlikely at this point.

Incidentally, there are actually a few indirect ways to "create" a collection in Ordinals that are part of the standards of Ordinals or Bitcoin.

1. Low inscription numbers. Ordinals has standardized the Inscription, so the first 1,000 inscriptions, or the first 10,000 inscriptions are built in "collections" that follow standards set by Ordinals. We already see increased value for inscriptions in these low inscription number "collections."

2. Cursed inscriptions. Before Inscriptions themselves became a STANDARD, some inscriptions were ignored. These were given a "cursed" status as part of the Ordinals standardization in January 2024 (the Jubilee). These now form a cursed "collection." Cursed inscriptions can also be numbered, so there will be a low cursed inscription number "collection" that will form and have long term value.

3. Inscriptions on sequential sats. Sat numbering is a STANDARD in Ordinals, and inscriptions that are inscribed on a sequential sat range can form a collection that is easily recognized in the standard Ordinals.

4. Inscriptions created in a single block or single transaction. These form a "collection" because of the standards of Bitcoin.

5. Inscriptions created on certain types of sats. Uncommons, block 9, 450x, pizza.

There are other related ways to form collections using existing standards, or combinations of them. These can help "collections" that were created before the Parent-Child Provenance collection standard. 👉For future collections, using the STANDARD way to create a collection is essential for the long term value of that collection.

For the OCM Genesis collection, we focused on creating a collection with long term value, and it took over two years to create this collection on Bitcoin. We worked with the Ordinals team on the collection standard, and used Parent-Child Provenance for OCM Genesis. In addition, we used sequential sat numbers (45017800001-45017810000), and the parent inscription that contained the art of the whole 10k collection had a low inscription number (20219). The collection was batch inscribed so the multi inscription transactions grouped the collection from Bitcoin transactions. We were the first to do these things, and ended up being "Cursed" multiple times, the most cursed collection of 10k on block 9, 450x sats. 

OCM Genesis is a remarkable 10k Collection on Bitcoin, and the first and only 10k Parent-Child Provenance collection created in 2023. First and Cursed.👹

#BTC the only missing piece of the BTC Power Law Theory was the bubbles. Now I think I got what causes them. Here it is:
1. The halving causes a decrease in reward for the miners. This eliminates some weak links in the system and the system needs to respond with an increase in hashing power to adapt to this change otherwise they cannot achieve similar revenues before the halvings. 
2. This increase in hashing power brings more security to the system that increases the number of users users=hashrate^1/4 (even if it looks like FOMO, the halvings causes an inflow of new users). 
3. Because of the sudden changes this is less of the organic continuous inflow of users that is typical of times when we are in a bubble so the system overshoots and it goes into a bubble type of behavior. 
4. Hash rate cannot follow this overshot and it de-couples from the very top of the bubble (hash-rate doesn't follow the most extreme part of the bubble because it takes time to buy new machines, make investment in real estate and infrastructure and so on).
5. The bubble crashes and it goes back to the hard baseline where mining is barely profitable.

You’ve probably seen GreenpeaceUSA's Bitcoin report by now, and my response (if you haven't been blocked).

Here’s six things that every environmentalist, Bitcoin advocate, regulator, policymaker and media representative should know about GreenpeaceUSA. 

I've had this information for over a year, but have held back on going public with it until now because there were initially signs that GreenpeaceUSA would be open to engaging with environmentalists within the Bitcoin community. 

With them now blocking me from commenting on their posts, all hope of that has now ended. 

So here's what I can tell you about GreenpeaceUSA, and their campaign that have not been aired publicly until now, and which may surprise you.

Firstly, some context: I’m a former volunteer environmental campaigner with Greenpeace.

I once risked arrest to stand up for causes I believed in, including an anti-GMO campaign against McDonalds which was successful within 6 weeks, and hailed as an example of how creative direct action can yield fast results. 

One of the differences: we talked to McDonalds (something no one at GreenpeaceUSA is currently doing with the Bitcoin community). 

I know a number of people in the environmental movement, and I would like to thank them for their honesty in whistleblowing on a thoroughly misguided campaign from GreenpeaceUSA from start to finish.

1. GreenpeaceUSA’s campaign does NOT have the backing of Greenpeace International. In fact, other branches have asked questions of GreenpeaceUSA’s tactics, and even said that their campaign is damaging the Greenpeace brand, and has resulted in the loss of subscriptions.

2. Within GreenpeaceUSA, there are a growing number of voices of discontent. There is a growing division between some of the younger crypto-neutral or crypto-friendly millennial in their base, and the directorship of GreenpeaceUSA

3. As we know, GreenpeaceUSA did receive a $5Million donation from Ripple’s chair Chris Larsen to run an anti-Bitcoin campaign. What you probably do not know is that within Greenpeace, several staff have questioned whether this is ethical, or in the spirit of an organization that says it relies only on grassroots funding in its sign-up pledge.

4. Some members of EWG and SierraClub, particularly younger members, were not enamoured with their organization’s collusion with GreenpeaceUSA’s “Change the Code” campaign. EWG has not engaged in anti-Bitcoin rhetoric since 6 April ‘23.

5. The head of GreenpeaceUSA’s “Change the Code” campaign has stepped down and is no longer any part of GreenpeaceUSA. At the time of his stepping down he was reported by a source within GreenpeaceUSA to be questioning the wisdom of the campaign.

6. Within GreenpeaceUSA, we know from multiple inside sources that the Change the Code campaign has been widely acknowledged to have been “not particularly successful”. 

GreenpeaceUSA’s campaign got off on the wrong foot right from the start, by antagonising environmentalists within the Bitcoin community, such as me. Here’s its half-time report (TL;DR, the worst performing environmental campaign I’ve ever witnessed).
https://t.co/ApAS7hdiPK

Now, the campaign is in more disarray than ever, resorting to tenuous ad hominem attacks against Satoshi Action, based on the discover that one of their supporters is a climate denier. True. Well, guess what: one of their supporters is also a plant-based, tree-hugging, climate-activist & meditation teacher: me. 

That’s the beauty of Bitcoin: it pulls people in from across the political spectrum: we are as diverse as society itself, and that’s what makes us strong. As I wrote recently, “when the ship you’re standing on is sinking: it doesn’t matter if you’re on the left of right side of it.”

I hoped GreenpeaceUSA would end their anti-Bitcoin campaign before their credibility and relevance to the new generation of millennials they are currently disenfranchising is completely severed. But it seems at the moment they are more intent on doubling down on misinformation. Their leadership must change for them to ever have hope of becoming a true voice for the environment again.

How to think about #bitcoin bull markets and the halving: 🧵 

We are not yet in a bull market. How do I know? 

Because bull markets in #bitcoin are mass psychological phenomena. They are the periodic, large-scale repricing of an exponential asset as it enters a new psychological range in the human mind,  which intuits value within a linear space.

The idea that something might be worth 2x or 0.5x what it is currently valued is intuitive. The idea that something might be 10x or 100x more valuable is not. It requires a step-change in perception, and it happens when the market overcomes mass psychological resistance.

What causes this? Well, the halving (obviously), but it’s more than just the halving.

From the very inception of #bitcoin there were, broadly, two groups of adopters: true believers, and open-minded skeptics. 

There is obviously somewhat of a continuum between these groups, but it is not clinal.

The “true believer” coins are psychologically separable and remain highly illiquid across 5+ years. Very few of them move, even in bull markets. Think @saylor, think @maxkeiser, think Satoshi. 

“Lost” coins fall into this group for all intents and purposes - and the sheer volume (millions!!!) of lost coins during #bitcoin’s early history account for the rapid rise in value in its early years. 

Additionally, the relative proportion of coins held by “true believer” types was quite high because you had to be a relatively niche person ideologically to have even heard of #bitcoin in, say, 2012. 

People in this group are hodling forever. They may sell a bit during bull markets in order to buy things (guns perhaps, a citadel in El Salvador), but they’re not diversifying or rotating their profits into crypto or other fiat investments.

This is contrasted with the #BTC that are actively traded within the broader “crYpTo” ecosystem, which are primarily held by “cycle timing” traders and other degenerates, and which remain relatively liquid within and particularly between cycles. I think we have seen diminishing returns on #BTC over the past two cycles largely because the Coinbase-led crypto casino-shitcoin-industrial complex expanded the relative volume of coins held by this demographic. 

Another way to think of this is that everyone pays the market price for their #bitcoin, but there is one group who assigns it a much higher VALUE and in terms of where they might be willing to sell. 

Like all markets there will be a psychological equilibrium that develops between these groups during a cycle. 

Newly mined coins are for all intents and purposes sold into the market every day - as we’ve established, miners are demand-side, not supply-side - and because #bitcoin is the revenue from which they must pay costs in a competitive and volatile market, these coins are highly liquid, with some steady state of coins flowing from weak (trader) to stronger (true believer) hands but being replenished by newly-mined #BTC.

This is where the halving comes in: when the flow into the pool of highly-liquid #BTC halves, this accelerates the rate at which the pool of highly-liquid coins drains into the pool of highly-illiquid coins and massively alters the market equilibrium. It acts like a price-insensitive buyer coming in and buying half of the replenishing flow into that pool.

That pool - the liquid pool - is what determines the price as price is inherently liquidity-weighted. 

At some point post-halving, that pool drains to the point of forcing a mass psychological upward dislocation from an established linear range closer to the value assigned to #BTC by the “true believers,” which is upward to infinity on an exponential trajectory. 

Fin. ✂️🧵

Remember, starting next week, institutional investment managers will file their 13F forms with the SEC. This means we'll start to get a look at who's been buying the Bitcoin ETFs. A few points:

1. These filings will start with a trickle next week, then pick up after that and run well into May.

2. The most interesting names could come later in the filing process, since some funds like to wait as long as possible in order to not show their hand before the mid-May deadline.

3. If you're a fund whose ownership of the ETF will make headlines and potentially impact price, you're probably going to want to top off your position before filing your 13F.

Again, I expect some surprises. Watch this space for names.
