For the vocal minority who is saying, "It's over for $HEX on #Ethereum..." because of the @BankXio guys putting $14m of #HEX for sale, I have some old #cryptocurrency lore for you.

There was once such a bear whale in #Bitcoin back about a decade ago. He trapped the price below $300 for many months. 

The slaying of the 🐻🐳 bear whale: https://t.co/7PyFjhLT4b

You can read about how invigorated the market became after slaying the BearWhale in this excerpt from @CoinDesk here: "Traders appear to have been reinvigorated by blood in the water this week in the aftermath of the slaying of the 'BearWhale' last Monday. The bitcoin price was $327 at the start of last week and it was trading for $370 at the week's end, according to the CoinDesk Bitcoin Price Index. After weeks of tepid trading volumes, bitcoin exchanges showed a surge in orders, hitting 642,000 BTC on 9th October. This almost topped the 657,000 BTC in total trading volume at the height of the buying activity as the massive sell order of 26,000 coins was unloaded by the so-called BearWhale on the market on Sunday."

You can read the BearWhale's signed message at this reddit link: https://t.co/Vq6XBNpnIO

This phase will easily pass for HEX and if you think that, in this world filled with trillions of dollars of wealth, that HEX isn't going to get bought up and go to dozens of dollars a token, you simply don't understand economics or where value is derived from.

If you believe that $14 million is what stands in the way between HEX going to all time high's or dying off entirely, I have bad news for you. Your understanding of markets is completely vapid and irrelevant.

This is a tremendous opportunity for a whole new class of HEX users to gain a bigger portion of the pie that otherwise would take many months to accumulate and would likely result in much higher cost to them. 

It is also an opportunity for the community to come together and begin to chip away at the order book before FOMO induces a rush of millions of dollars in bids onto the HEX market.

This BearWhale will soon be slayed and we will all be looking into the rearview wishing we had another chance to buy under 3 cents.

#Bitcoin on the edge of consolidation and rotation to Ethereum & Altseason is the play?

I'm always trying to allocate as much as possible towards segments that I find interesting. 

At this point, the strength in Ethereum starts to pick up. Why is that a good bet? Let's discuss👇

First, the markets have been going through a tremendous run as Bitcoin has accelerated from $25,000 to $53,000 in three months. In the meantime, other ecosystems have also been showing a ton of momentum, with the biggest winners being Solana, Injective Protocol, and Render Protocol.

1⃣ - Bitcoin's strength topping out -> Rotation?

A few things should be considered when we're discussing this topic. 

Strength topping out isn't a sign of a top bull market; it's just that, in short, the valuation of Bitcoin is overpriced and needs to come back to reality, according to the markets. 

For instance, right now, the markets have been rushing up by 100% in one go, which usually isn't a trigger for a large group of investors to step into the markets, and they'd instead be waiting for a correction to happen.

The question is, how are you defining investors? Well, in this case, it is not by the number of investors but by liquidity being interested in entering the markets. 

On the other hand, Bitcoin's inflow is positive for the markets as the ETF inflow shows additional interest from institutional parties to get into the markets. That's good. However, they are not the only ones in the markets, and they are not pushing the valuation of Bitcoin on their own.

They are a significant variable, but not the only one. As a matter of fact, it's more likely that we'll be seeing organic corrections taking place and a longer cycle due to it. Rotations happen based on macroeconomic events rather than crypto-native events, so things like CPI, FOMC, GDP, and liquidity will be market-movers rather than FVG's. 

Additionally, the halving event is going to have its impact. Usually, there's a short-term peak before the halving, resulting in the standard 20-40% correction before the continuation of the market. 

Close to that correction, that's where the sweet spot lies for rotation towards altcoins, and it seems we're seeing the first signals. 

2⃣ - #Ethereum's strength -> Dencun upgrade & Potential Spot ETF

Ethereum is getting underestimated by a mile. Because the price hasn't been performing as it should in the past few years, it means that it will be doing the same in the coming period. Works in all markets. 

Compare it with the price action of Bitcoin. I bet you that most people have been anticipating further declines when Bitcoin was at $15K, while all the heavy news events were already priced in. The sentiment was different as emotions were taking an enormous toll.

The same is corresponding with Ethereum. The Dencun upgrade is around the corner, which will lower the transaction costs for Layer 2's by 90%, making it accessible to be the settlement layer that we all wish it was. 

That's triggering a lot of momentum towards the Ethereum network and combined with the potential Spot ETF approval, this can only bring fireworks. 

The valuation of Ethereum as a whole needs to catch up as it should be at $3,800-4,200 if it's at the same stage as Bitcoin's price currently. Bitcoin will consolidate, and money will rotate towards Ethereum.  

3⃣ - Altseason -> What's the definition of this?

It's a loud and clear message. Altseason. 

The term originates from 2017, when literally everything was going through the roof in a few months' time, and a rotation game happens through the markets where Bitcoin moves first, then Ethereum, then the rest.

However, that is still the case, but things are more complex. Why is that? Well, it's relatively simple. If you've invested in the Solana ecosystem the past few months, you would have been in an alt season yourself. 

However, when investing in the Ethereum ecosystem, you would have needed to catch up as most have been underperforming. Therefore, the definition of alt season is relatively skewed and should be framed as something correlated to an ecosystem. 

In this aspect, we're facing an 'Ethereum Altseason'. 

4⃣ - #Bitcoin Dominance peaks pre-halving

History repeating itself, it seems very likely. 

In every cycle, the dominance of Bitcoin has peaked prior to the halving. Very understandable, as investors are rotating their profits from holding Bitcoin towards other assets to generate a higher ROI as there's no event that's going to push confidence within Bitcoin at all.

On the other hand, projects are delaying their upgrades to after the Bitcoin halving due to the same reasoning. 

And finally, investors need confidence to jump into the markets and Bitcoin is the biggest asset for that. Once that one has finalized its run, that will be the moment where the rotation towards other ecosystems takes place. 

In that aspect, we're on the edge of the same at this stage. 

We're going to be topping out with Bitcoin relatively soon. A peak to $54-58K pre-halving and a harsh correction to $45-48K. 

That correction is going to be painful, but altcoins are going to feel less pain from that actual event as they are stronger in their BTC pairs -> money rotating towards altcoins is basically that confirmation you're looking for.

Recently, Ethereum has shown more strength than Bitcoin, and the entire ecosystem is on the edge of a breakout.

My gameplan is to take profits from Bitcoin and rotate towards Ethereum, but also ensure that I cover my position by increasing my USDT stack for a potential correction.

If that correction happens, maximize the allocation towards the Ethereum ecosystem and some more. 

Will be updating that in the coming days/weeks. Hit like if you enjoy these long reads!

The slaying of the 🐻🐳 bear whale: https://t.co/7PyFjhLT4b

You can read about how invigorated the market became after slaying the BearWhale in this excerpt from @CoinDesk here: "Traders appear to have been reinvigorated by blood in the water this week in the aftermath of the slaying of the 'BearWhale' last Monday. The bitcoin price was $327 at the start of last week and it was trading for $370 at the week's end, according to the CoinDesk Bitcoin Price Index. After weeks of tepid trading volumes, bitcoin exchanges showed a surge in orders, hitting 642,000 BTC on 9th October. This almost topped the 657,000 BTC in total trading volume at the height of the buying activity as the massive sell order of 26,000 coins was unloaded by the so-called BearWhale on the market on Sunday."

#Ethereum at $2,980.

The cynical sounds that Ethereum wouldn't provide anything as it was only downtrending. 

This is still a massive period to be rotating from Bitcoin towards Ethereum. 

The upward momentum is continuing in Ethereum, not in Bitcoin.

Should we stop innovating because we have #Bitcoin and #Ethereum?

Technological progress must continue because current technologies are objectively not advanced enough for mass adoption.

Why?

The list of problems is long:

- Expensive fees
- Failed transaction
- Low scalability
- Declining decentralization
- Every day a security incident in DeFi
- Staking on Ethereum requires third parties and banking licenses in some countries
- Bitcoin and Ethereum teams have given up on L1 scaling
- Self-custody is complicated for people
- Vitalik and his team have doubts about Ethereum security
- Integration with TradFi is complex
- High dependence on centralized infrastructure
- Etc.

I am glad that innovation is taking place in all ecosystems.

BUT! 

The Bitcoin team does not want to change Bitcoin much. The pace of innovation is slow. Many devs left the ecosystem.

The Ethereum team chases the L2 scaling which seems risky. The pace of innovation is fast. Things get often broken.

To say that the oldest projects will be around forever is a deliberate disregard of history.

First-mover advantage is not a guarantee of success in a young industry that has everything yet to come.

Younger projects like Cardano could learn from the mistakes of their predecessors. 

Academic approach, peer review, and formal methods make sense for the newly built financial world. This is often ignored even though it is absolutely critical to success.

#Cardano addresses many of the listed issues:

- Fixed and predictable fees
- Determinism
- Plan to pay fees in tokens and stables
- High decentralization + on-chain governance
- Plan to scale L1
- No DeFi hack yet
- Both the IOG team and the community trust the protocol
- Parallelism

The crypto industry is not about one or two winners. It's not even about the three winners.

Sooner or later, dominant projects will lose their market share and be replaced by a new one. It is natural and normal. 

Who uses MySpace today? Who remembers Miranda? Who downloads songs from the Pirate Bay.

It is premature to talk about a winner with the adoption of crypto around 5%.

In the Web3 realm, privacy & data sovereignty present formidable hurdles. Innovations like Filecoin, IPFS, & Arweave introduce off-chain storage solutions but falter in privacy due to their inherent public visibility. Enter Ten, a transformative L2 on Ethereum, that brings encryption into the fold for bespoke privacy & nuanced control over on-chain actions. Conversely, @Verida_io is revolutionizing decentralized private data storage, granting users unprecedented command over their off-chain data.

The partnership between Ten & Verida combines off-chain data encryption with on-chain encryption. This facilitates a range of new possibilities within Web3, such as Private Messaging w/ Media Sharing, where Ten ensures chat & on-chain footprint remain confidential, while Verida safeguards the privacy of shared media. This collaboration also opens doors to innovative applications in Parametric Insurance, Identity Management, etc - these are just a glimpse of what becomes feasible with our combined tech.

Our partnership signals a new era where users wield absolute authority over their digital identities, data, & interactions, both on-chain & off-chain. Together, we pave the way for a Web3 ecosystem where encryption is not just an option but a fundamental standard.

My Bitcoin Journey: The Road to Becoming a Wizard 🧙‍♂️🪄

Nine months ago, I knew almost nothing about Bitcoin from a technical standpoint. I had just started working with the @TaprootWizards in a part-time capacity, and it became glaringly obvious to me that all my Ethereum knowledge was not going to cut it on Bitcoin. Next to the 10 years of experience that both Udi & Eric had, I felt completely out of my depth.

Fast forward to today, I'm:
- Teaching Bitcoin fundamentals with @nonfungible_jan at @TechnicallyBTC
- Discussing crazy L2 constructions utilizing OP_CAT with @rot13maxi and @ercwl
- Writing a Lamport signature implementation on Bitcoin for fun

But the road I walked to get to this point was one fraught with challenges and sacrifice.

---
My first day working with @udiwertheimer, I asked him for the fastest way I could level up my technical understanding of Bitcoin. He recommended starting with Programming Bitcoin by Ordinals enjoyoor @jimmysong. I'm not a dev by trade or training, but I didn't let that stop me.

Every weekend in June, July, & September, I committed myself to working through a chapter of this book. 

At this point, I was still at my old VC job, working part-time for the Taproot Wizards, and trying to keep up with everything Ordinals. This meant that every weekend I declined to hang out with friends, hardly saw my girlfriend, dropped my other hobbies, and hammered on the fundamentals of Bitcoin programming.

This decision to sacrifice almost all other areas of life to dedicate time to Bitcoin has become the story of my year. After Programming Bitcoin, it was BitVM. After BitVM, it was BIP Land. After BIP Land, it was and is OP_CAT.

Becoming an expert in any space requires an immense amount dedication and resilience. Anyone can put in this effort for a brief span. But to truly become great, you have to put in the work no one else sees, day in and day out, even when you don't want to. 

It has begun to pay off, but it's taken nearly a year of late nights, early mornings, and missed weekends to get to where I am. And along the way, there were no accolades, no boost in followers, only the internal reward of knowledge gained.

I plan to build legendary products with the Taproot Wizards, and the only way that happens is by continuing to push myself to be the absolute best at what I do. I know that if we achieve our goals, that will be the ultimate reward.

So to all the Bitcoiners out there who are grinding in the shadows every day, I want to say:

I see the work you put in
I know the sacrifice it takes to be excellent
The work that is done in the dark
When no one is watching
When it's just you vs. yourself
Keep working
Keep grinding
Challenge yourself to be better than you were yesterday
The success will come
And never forget the people who made sacrifices so that you could strive to become legendary

Ethereum’s Shanghai Upgrade is coming to Immutable zkEVM!

We are committed to keeping Immutable zkEVM, powered by @0xPolygon, as close to Ethereum as possible to benefit from its security and network effects.

The Shanghai hard fork will occur on zkEVM Testnet on 12 March 2024 at 10 PM UTC and zkEVM Mainnet on 26 March 2024 at 10 PM UTC.

This upgrade will allow us to integrate with Polygon Zero (zk-prover) and enable shadow proving following the adjustment.

If you are a Solidity smart contract developer, no action is required! Once the hard fork is live, we will fully support Solidity 0.8.20 and onwards alongside OpenZeppelin v5.0.

Anyone running an RPC node on Immutable zkEVM will need to deploy the latest immutable/go-ethereum Docker image version 1.0.0-beta.1 to stay in sync with the network once the hard fork date has passed.

The rest of the developers and users interacting with the Immutable Platform, continue building and playing.

The EDI Dashboard presents 7 distinct graphs, each showcasing the results for 7 prominent blockchains: 

➡️#Bitcoin 
➡️#BitcoinCash
➡️#Cardano
➡️#Ethereum
➡️#Litecoin
➡️#Tezos
➡️#ZCash

Let's look at the first four metrics.

The Nakamoto Coefficient is a measure of a blockchain’s decentralization.

It’s determined by counting the minimum number of entities that collectively produce more than 50% of the total blocks within a given timeframe.

The output of this metric is an integer.

A higher Nakamoto Coefficient signifies a higher level of decentralization.

Conversely, if the Nakamoto coefficient were 1, it would imply that a single entity, such as a single pool, produces more than half of all blocks in the network, indicating a high level of centralization.

The result refers to entities (nodes) that can produce blocks, irrespective of the resources that may be delegated to these entities by several other entities.

For instance, miners delegate hash-rate to Bitcoin pools. $ADA stakers delegate coins to Cardano pools.

See Figure 1.

Cardano, with a Nakamoto coefficient of 58, significantly surpasses other blockchains in this metric. 

In comparison, Bitcoin and Ethereum have a significantly lower Nakamoto coefficient of just 2. 

Tezos, with a coefficient of 7, comes in second place.

Community tools often report a Nakamoto coefficient of around 35, which is approximately half of what is reported for Cardano by the EDI dashboard. 

This discrepancy between the scientists' results and the community tools warrants further investigation.

The Gini coefficient represents the degree of inequality in block production. 

The output of the metric is a decimal number in [0,1]. 

Values close to 0 indicate equality (all entities in the system produce the same number of blocks) and values close to 1 indicate inequality (one entity produces most or all blocks).

In a perfect scenario of absolute equality, each node in the network would generate an equal number of blocks over the same timeframe and receive identical rewards. 

However, this would necessitate a one-person-one-vote system, which is unattainable in a decentralized network. 

The number of blocks produced by each entity is contingent on the resources it has at its disposal, whether owned directly or delegated to it.

It's noteworthy that a majority of blockchain networks naturally tend towards increased inequality.

See Figure 2.

Cardano topped this metric with a score of 0.906. 

Tezos followed closely in second place, scoring 0.967. 

Bitcoin secured the third position with a score of 0.974.

Entropy represents the expected amount of information in the distribution of blocks across entities. 

The output of the metric is a real number. Typically, a higher value of entropy indicates higher decentralization (lower predictability).

In the context of blockchain networks, a higher entropy value is generally considered better for decentralization.

Entropy measures the unpredictability or randomness of data. 

If the entropy is high, it means that the data is very random and therefore, it’s hard to predict. 

If the entropy is high, it’s harder to predict which node will produce the next block. 

This unpredictability contributes to the security and fairness of the network, as it prevents any single node from dominating the block production process.

It ensures that power and control are not concentrated in the hands of a few nodes, but are instead spread out across the network. 

This is a key aspect of maintaining a healthy and robust decentralized system.

See Figure 3.

Cardano took first place with a value of 8.12. In second place is Tezos with a value of 5.28. Third is Bitcoin Cash with a value of 3.63.

The Herfindahl-Hirschman Index (HHI) is a measure of market concentration.

It is defined as the sum of the squares of the market shares (as whole numbers, e.g. 40 for 40%) of the entities in the system.

The output of the metric is a real number in (0, 10000). 

Values close to 0 indicate low concentration (many entities produce a similar number of blocks) and values close to 10000 indicate high concentration (one entity produces most or all blocks).

The closer a market is to a monopoly, the higher the market’s concentration (and the lower its competition).

The U.S. Department of Justice has set the following thresholds for interpreting HHI values (in traditional markets):

➡️(0, 1500): Competitive market
➡️[1500, 2500]: Moderately concentrated market
➡️(2500, 10000): Highly concentrated market

In a regular market, as in decentralization, high competitiveness is a healthy and desirable characteristic.

See Figure 4.

Cardano, Tezos, and Bitcoin Cash, with values of 82.5, 604, and 1068 respectively, have emerged as the top performers. 

Their networks exhibit high competitiveness, with numerous entities producing a comparable number of blocks.

In contrast, a moderate level of market concentration is observed in the case of other projects.

Cardano won in all metrics, a success that can be linked to its status as one of the newest PoS blockchain networks on the EDI Dashboard.

Bitcoin, being the oldest blockchain, showed the poorest results in certain metrics and was generally subpar in others.

Ethereum, a relatively older blockchain that transitioned from PoW to PoS, didn’t see substantial enhancements in decentralization following the switch. 

For instance, the Nakamoto coefficient remained unchanged. The Herfindahl-Hirschman Index (HHI) even experienced a decline. 

This result shows how significantly PoS networks can differ in decentralization.

Cardano has had PoS longer than Ethereum, yet the network is more decentralized.

Decentralization is not only about network consensus. 

Other aspects are important. 

For example, in governance, Cardano might not be at its best because of Genesis keys. 

However, the IOG team will address this shortcoming, so Cardano will improve in this metric over time, similar to the significant improvement seen after the Shelley hardfork that brought staking. 

Metrics related to governance are not yet available in the EDI dashboard.

Our mission is to preserve Ethereum's core value: composability.

Based Espresso is our latest development towards a future of composable L2s.

This design sees L2s retain autonomy over their sequencing rights, and supports any Ethereum L2, from based rollups to validiums: https://t.co/Up5iXkrZC1

13 March will be the most important date for @ethereum since the Merge. 
TLDR: 
- It will undergo a hardfork to implement EIP-4844 (proto-danksharding) which brings huge +ve impact on L2s, as fees on L2s would then be 10x cheaper than it is today. 
- This will create a flywheel that isn't possible on L1s: the more the users, the cheaper the fees, and more users attract more devs and dapps, which further drive down the fees with even more users.

Context:
- To understand how the L2 cost structure can be improved significantly, we need to understand there is fixed cost and variable cost for running an L2:
1. FIXED L2 operator costs: to expend the computational resources to process the rollup data, i.e., maintain a transaction pool, sequence batches, compute state roots/state diffs/validity proofs, etc. The cost is FIXED since it won't change much compared to the network load and traffic.
2. VARIABLE L1 data publication costs: once operators have assembled a large enough set of tx, they will post a compressed summary of the set to L1. It is variable as the cost depends very much on how much data is posted on L1. This is the main driver for L2 fees.
- Data is published on L1 by simply posting it as ‘CALLDATA’, a txn attribute which allows the sender to add an arbitrary sequence of bytes. 
- The costs associated with posting through CALLDATA are a large expense for L2s. According to the Dune Rollup Economics Dashboard by @0xKofi, L2s spent 15k+ ETH (>$60M USD) writing to Ethereum in December of 2023 alone!
- After Dencun, EIP-4844 will create space for BLOBS of data which can be used by L2s for settlement instead of CALLDATA, reducing fees for L2s by at least an order of magnitude.

EIP-4844 in brief:
- Each block can have up to 6 total blobs
- Each blob stores up to 128kb of data. If the entire 128kb is not used, the tx sender still pays for 128kb of blob space (some research about the timing for L2s to wait and fill a blob entirely, and/or coordinate with other L2s to share blob space.).
- Blobs are only required to be stored for 4096 epochs (~18 days), which are considered available long enough for all actors of L2s to retrieve, but short enough to keep disk use manageable. This allows blobs to be priced much cheaper than calldata, which is stored forever.
- EIP-4844 will create a new blob gas market, which will operate similarly to EIP-1559, varying the blob base fee based on supply and demand: if there are more blobs in the block than the target, blob base fee is increased, and vice versa

It is expected that L2 activities will skyrocket with much much cheaper fee, so does the number of L2s. The next imminent issue @ethereum has to solve is liquidity fragmentation: @drakefjustin with @benafisch from @EspressoSys and others are actively working on universal synchronous composability where L2s which are 'based' can interact seamlessly among one another, via shared sequencing on L1 and real-time settlement. I view it as a strategic move with the benefit of the foresight of L2 development after Dencun upgrade.

How to hard-fork to save most users' funds in a quantum emergency

By:
- vbuterin

🔗 https://t.co/nBPOgveKB9

Highlights:
- Quantum computers could potentially break the security of Ethereum, making it possible to steal users' funds by reversing the encryption that protects private keys.
-The Ethereum blockchain can be updated (hard fork) to protect users' funds in the event of a quantum attack, requiring users to download new wallet software.
-Most users' private keys are generated through a series of hash calculations, which provides a foundation for creating a recovery mechanism.
-A proposed Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) includes steps like reverting transactions after theft is detected, disabling traditional transactions, and introducing new transaction types for enhanced security.
-The use of STARK proofs for transactions allows for the secure transition of accounts to a quantum-resistant state, ensuring the safety of users' funds in a post-quantum world.

ELI5:
Imagine if bad guys got super powerful computers (quantum computers) that could easily break the security protecting our digital money (like Ethereum). This article talks about a plan to quickly update Ethereum to protect everyone's money by making a big change (hard fork) to how Ethereum works, so that these super computers can't steal from us.

Ethereum's golden age

Are we ~2 months away from the start of a long golden age for Ethereum and ETH?

imo new changes to three big factors suggest yes, an ETH golden age is about to begin.

Recent price increases have been great.

But regrettably, ETH has still been underperforming for years. That's about to change.

ETH's underperformance these past years comes down imo to three things

1. ETH has been seen as illegitimate

Many people, including institutional investors, seem to have expected the US govt to declare ETH a security and/or remain hostile to (or even try to shut down) Ethereum.

The ETH ETF is expected in May and unambiguously, instantly makes ETH globally legitimate forever.

There seems to be agreement among ETF experts that it's become legally and politically impossible for the SEC to deny the ETH ETF. And, Blackrock.

2. L2s have been viewed as clunky

For all the hassle of bridging to new chains and the resulting fragmentation, L2 fees are still pretty high.

EIP-4844 blobs launch next week and fix this.

L2 fees may be expected to remain low even as growth explodes, due to blobs having their own fee market, validiums, blob count increases in future hard forks, and many incoming tech items.

At the same time, the ongoing work of our amazing L2 ecosystems and wallets is steadily solving distribution, UX, and fragmentation.

For example, Base is on the cusp of onboarding Coinbase CEX users directly to L2 without requiring them to withdraw to a self custody wallet.

~100M Coinbase exchange users will be able to "connect wallet" to uniswap or any Eth app from the comfort of their custodial account.

L2s are becoming truly cheap to use at scale and buttery smooth.

The final item driving ETH's underperformance these past years is

3. L2s have been seen as parasitic to ETH

Many people still think L2s harm ETH by siphoning users, capital, fees, and network effects to L2.

In reality, ETH has a fundamentally symbiotic relationship with L2s.

This L2<>L1 symbiosis is about to become widely understood and put to rest the incorrect notion that L2s are parasitic to ETH. Here's why-

The theory that ETH and L2s are symbiotic goes like this:

Consider the coming future where billions of users and trillions of $ are on L2. This would obviously imply a huge increase in L1 bridging, settlement, and DA activity. That activity is direct growth for the L1 hub and feeds into the ETH valuation.

This is not a complex theory. But both serious crypto investors and newcomers have found it mostly uncompelling.

What's changing now is that we finally have data to support the theory.

Great sites to explore the L2<>L1 symbiosis include L2Beat, GrowThePie, and some Dune dashboards.

The new data show there will be many large L2s- not only a few- using L1 as the hub.

The new data show that L2s can be relied upon for the long term to pay significant fees to the L1 and depend on the L1 for a growing variety of use cases, including settlement, DA, bridging, token registration, and L2 sequencer coordination.

The new data show that L2 growth and L1 growth happen together:

At the same time L2 growth is exploding, L1 activity is strengthening across the board, such as in L1 defi, bridging, and token/protocol deployments.

What we're seeing is an expansion to L2 while the L1 keeps growing. Not a migration to L2.

As a result of these new data and new efforts to visualize and communicate L2<>L1 symbiosis, the once-popular view that L2s are parasitic to ETH is on life support and will soon die.

In short

- ETH has been seen as illegitimate. The ETH ETF in May fixes this.

- L2s have been viewed as clunky. Blobs next week and general growth are fixing this.

- L2s have been seen as parasitic to ETH. The latest data on L2<>L1 symbiosis fixes this.

As these items get solved, the reasons for ETH's underperformance these past years are ending.

ETH is about to become a consensus bet.

Yesterday was my 1 year anniversary working at Polygon Labs (@0xPolygon)!

I joined Polygon Labs because I felt that it had the best technology to enable a future for Ethereum to scale and it had a solid group of leaders and builders. I can say that is still true, and even better, there are efforts in place to go beyond blockchain scaling and help the wider community.

The Labs legal policy team launched The Value Prop (https://t.co/WFfenqVJu7), @0xPolygonMiden is building unique privacy tech, and @0xPolygonID (soon to spin off) is an amazing privacy preserving ID solution. The point is, Polygon Labs is laser focused on the Agg Layer and CDK in 2024 on the tech. side, but our dedication to the wider ecosystem and being a force for good is shown by our actions across other domains.

I love the people I work with! Beyond being talented, they are fun to be around and are collaborative. I have fun going into work every day, which is a super rare thing for people to say! I am very lucky!

Under the leadership of @aliciakatz and @ajaypv4, the Protocol Developer Community team I am on is doing great things. Expect 10000% more visibility on what we are doing as the next few months progress 👀
Follow @0xAbix @adidshaft @KenilShahh from the team!

I want to give a special shout-out to my friend @MihailoBjelic who brought me into the org. I had known since before Polygon was even a thing and have seen Polygon grow from it's infancy when I was an advisor to today.

I am more bullish than ever on where Polygon is heading and the adventures that will be made along the way 😎

🆕🛠️ #Ethereum Dencun upgrade went live on Goerli testnet, but faced delay in finalization ⏳

After this upgrade the $ETH fees is expected to go down significantly. We still need to see the impact. If successful, this upgrade could significantly boost Ethereum adoption.

Here are the sequence of events:

➔ Scheduled for 6:32 UTC, the upgrade commenced but failed to finalize on Goerli testnet as anticipated.
➔ Finality crucial for irreversible transaction confirmation & block addition in blockchain networks.
➔ Dencun's deployment on Goerli marks phase one of a comprehensive approach towards implementing "proto-danksharding."
➔ Proto-danksharding aims to enhance data storage efficiency & reduce transaction costs for layer-2 blockchains.
➔ Testnets like Goerli simulate real-world blockchain environments, ensuring thorough testing before mainnet deployment.
➔ Next phases involve upgrades on Sepolia & Holesky testnets, paving the way for broader implementation.
➔ Dencun signifies Ethereum's major upgrade since Shapella last March, pivotal for its transition to proof-of-stake consensus mechanism.

ETH ETF next? Well, stay tuned for further updates as Ethereum continues its evolution towards a more scalable and sustainable blockchain ecosystem! Transition to proof-of-stake!

The implementation of EIP-1559 on the #Shibarium network signifies the adaptation of #Ethereum’s transaction fee mechanism to #Shibarium. This could mean that #Shibarium will also have a similar fee burning and dynamic fee mechanism.
The main innovations brought by EIP-1559 in #Ethereum are:
Base Fee: Automatically adjusted based on the current network congestion and is the minimum fee that must be paid for every transaction.
Tip: An extra fee that users can pay to miners if they want their transactions to be confirmed more quickly.
Fee Burning: The base fee collected with each transaction is “burned” by the network, meaning it is removed from circulation.
The application of EIP-1559 to Shibarium could contribute to making transaction fees more predictable and efficient, enhancing network security, and giving the Shibarium token economy a deflationary structure. Additionally, it could enable Shibarium to reduce the load on the Ethereum network, providing faster and cheaper transactions.

A storm is brewing for #Ethereum. Let's recap some important facts.

1) Bill Hinman with Jay Clayton's approval gave a speech that said $ETH was not a security. However, he had major conflicts of interest because the law firm he was getting paid by was part of the Ethereum Alliance. Empower Oversight was able to get emails and communications showing Hinman was warned by SEC ethics office about these conflicts. Empower is currently suing the SEC again to get access to more docs/communications on this matter.

2) Ethereum switched from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake which changes the thesis of what Hinman/Clayton based their analysis on to give Ethereum a non security classsification.

3) Gary Gensler refuses to state if Ethereum is a security or not. He won't echo the statements of Hinman and Clayton. Even before Congress he refused to answer.

4) Gary will most likely take the Ethereum ETF situation to the courts. Recently, CFTC chair Rostin Behnam spoke before Congress highlighting the difference in view of the CFTC vs SEC on Ethereum being a commodity vs security.

5) The SEC and Gary Gensler approved Prometheum's license to custody Ethereum as a security. In my interview with Aaron Kaplan he echoed Gary's classification of altcoins as "Digital Asset Securities"

Now reports are coming out from Fortune that a government is investigating the Ethereum Foundation and the SEC is looking to classify ETH as a security.

What could save this storm from becoming a category 5 tornado with massive destruction to the crypto industry, government officials, SEC and more? Congress will have to pass legislation.

I don't know if any of this will affect ETH's performance in the bull market. It may or may not. I've seen crazy things in the crypto market.

I believe the entire crypto industry will always be grateful to #Ethereum and @VitalikButerin for paving the way for Web3. 

$ETH deserves everyone's respect for that! 👑

However, after almost 10 years of existence, it’s becoming more and more evident that Ethereum is definitely not fit for purpose and probably never will be.

#Algorand, along with other blockchains/DLTs, in much less time, is doing what Ethereum has still failed to do: providing a great and smooth experience for the average user and having a significant impact on the lives of millions of non-crypto people around the world, through real adoption of the technology.

And that's 100% understandable, just like the Internet, the first to come is not always the winner.

I'm not talking about L2, which, IMHO, are just a bandage on a wooden leg… L2s are useless when other L1s, much more efficient, more scalable, and especially more secure, exist.

I like #Ethereum, and I definitely don't see $ETH being flipped before a few years, mainly because the market is still too immature and speculative to be rational.

I mean, it’s very likely that more than 90% of ETH investors have probably never made a single transaction on it to realize how unsuitable it is for mass adoption.

But the more the market grows and matures, the more Ethereum will probably have difficulty keeping up.

Don't be fooled, although still early days, real world adoption of blockchain is already here, but definitely not on $ETH.

Just as an example, each day, millions of people board planes thanks to #Algorand or use $ALGO technology in their everyday lives without even knowing it. The biggest institutions are developing game-changing solutions on top of it (Digital Euro, TIPS solution, FIFA, etc)...

$HBAR also has many real use cases (ex: Avery Dennison), $AVAX is also gaining nice traction, #ADA too…

Unlike #BTC, Ethereum is not untouchable, many people often forget that in 2017 $XRP had already flipped $ETH. It's also naive to think that businesses or retail outside of crypto will want to use Ethereum as a priority rather than another blockchain/DLT. They just want reliable and affordable technology.

Anyway, just my 2 cents, thanks Ethereum! 🤝

OpenSea and the Seaport Working Group are thrilled to unveil Seaport 1.6 — the latest generation of the most advanced NFT marketplace protocol in the EVM ecosystem.

Seaport 1.6 introduces a new capability enabled by the recent Ethereum Dencun upgrade called Seaport hooks 🪝. Similar in spirit to Uniswap v4 hooks, Seaport hooks allow developers to build applications that greatly expand the utility and liquidity of NFTs.

Seaport hooks allow developers to create:
-NFTs whose traits modify or “upgrade” in response to the price or volume in which they’re purchased
-NFTs that can only be bought with certain currencies or other NFTs
-Bonding curves for automatically priced NFTs
-Price oracles for NFTs
-Many, many more applications to be dreamt up yet

PS: Seaport 1.6 is up to 5% cheaper in gas than Seaport 1.5 for certain actions, saving you $$$.

BLACKROCK LAUNCHING TOKENIZED ASSET FUND ON ETHEREUM, SEEDS IT WITH $100M

Blackrock, the world's largest asset manager, has taken significant steps towards integrating digital assets into its portfolio by submitting a request to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to launch a tokenized investment fund named the "Blackrock USD Institutional Digital Liquidity Fund" (BUIDL) on the Ethereum blockchain. This move underscores Blackrock's increasing embrace of digital assets, following its introduction of a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) and application to launch an Ishares Ethereum Trust, which it hopes to list on the Nasdaq, pending regulatory approval.

The BUIDL token was created on March 4, 2024, with a single address holding 100 BUIDL tokens. According to the fund's prospectus, it requires a minimum investment of $100,000, operating similarly to a short-term money market fund focused on investments in short-duration securities like commercial paper, certificates of deposit, and floating rate notes, with a substantial portion of its assets in cash reserves.

However, obtaining SEC approval for such digital asset initiatives poses a challenge, given the regulatory body's recent history of scrutinizing and delaying decisions on crypto-related products, including Blackrock's own application for a spot ethereum ETF. This reflects the broader context of regulatory actions against numerous cryptocurrency enterprises, highlighting the complexities of integrating traditional finance with the evolving digital asset landscape.

If Ethereum is declared a security in the USA I wouldn't be surprised that all POS crypto will also be classified as a security.

Controversial take that honestly really shouldn't be. But want to put on the table a topic that has been happening in many private conversations.

Solana is going to have and needs to have L2s and/or rollups.

I don't think these will manifest exactly like the Ethereum ecosystem, but there will always be app builders at scale that want more TPS, less competition for blockspace, lower fees, and that want to own more of the aggregate economics that their business generates.

It is insane that DRiP paid $10,000 in on-chain fees last week plus a plethora of other costs at the RPC level and in our cloud, not to mention the time rewriting our backend.

This is not a complaint, just an incentive-alignment problem that I'm not sure how to address at the base layer: The very apps that bring traffic and customers to the chain are rewarded with increased infra cost when the token appreciates in value, in part due to their efforts.

I think many app builders will be happy to make calculated decentralization tradeoffs to have favorable economics and TPS. And for users that want it, being able to pay extra to optionally secure their assets at the base layer makes tons of sense.

Please, read this is not as a criticism of our beloved chain. Simply as thinking about what needs to happen over the next few years to continue winning, from an app builder who is quite literally all in on Solana.

Two thirds of the value locked on DeFi across the crypto space is found on Ethereum and its L2s (source: https://t.co/8LKENBrPa5), and that's when you include the heavy subsidization of DeFi on BSC by Binance, and the dubious ponzi DeFi apps on Tron. Excluding those, and Ethereum is nearly the entire DeFi space. Ethereum provides by far the most hope of making crypto ubiquitous, through all of the development that has happened, and is being planned, to make it more scalable, and make it suitable for stablecoins, like: 

* Ethereum's original unique value proposition: Turing Completeness, which provides the computational versatility needed for efficient smart contracts for stablecoins 

* the development of Rollups, which have reduced fees by 100X already, with more fee reductions expected: https://t.co/pfmW58czjN 

* the Merge, which opens the door to datasharding to be implemented in future upgrades, which in turn will increase Rollup scalability 100 fold 

* EIP4844, which has reduced transaction fees on Rollups by at least an order of magnitude. 

All of these improvements are compounding, meaning by the completion of the final upgrade, Ethereum's maximum throughput will be 100,000 transactions per second, or 2,500X what it is with vanilla transactions. This is enough to onboard every retail transaction in the world and still charge fees well under $0.05 per transaction, and possibly under $0.01.

Don't fade RWA growth on Ethereum

Some Ethereum bears have been saying for years (and still say) that compliance and regulation will eventually stop Ethereum's real-world asset growth in its tracks.

It's a popular view, especially among people who actually work in compliance and regulation.

But if you want to know about water, don't ask a fish.

Tokenizing everything is far too useful to be stopped by regulations.

The game has changed. The world's many commercial and political interests aren't going to abandon the promise of tokenization because of the old rules of the game.

Life finds a way.

We have already seen many examples of tokenization finding a path to growth.

Two of my favorite examples are

- favorable tokenization jurisdictions, such as Germany, Switzerland, and Bermuda

- clever market design, like how Ondo's Flux market lets KYC'd holders borrow from permissionless lenders. Or how BlackRock's KYC BUIDL is collateral for the KYC'd USDM but USDM has permissionless secondary markets

The view that regulations will curb real-world asset growth is not only pessimistic but also totally out of line with the facts.

We are seeing a Cambrian explosion in the quantity and diversity of real-world assets, as well as hyper-growth in key metrics, such as RWA TVL, the number of funded RWA companies, and the bench depth of talented people working in RWA. https://t.co/0hV6wR3DOq

Tokenizing everything is the future. That future is rapidly arriving, and it's mostly occurring on Ethereum. Don't fade it!

I think it’s really funny how no one is looking at the #Polygon ecosystem for meme coins yet. 

I think there’s something there 🤔 

Hear me out..👇🏼

Prior to the #Solana meme coin mania craze of the past few months I didn’t really look at meme coins outside of the #Ethereum ecosystem because it’s been the biggest blockchain for meme coins in the past couple years following the Binance Smart Chain craze of 2021. 

What I came to realize with the #Solana hype is that meme coins can really move the market and get the liquidity over to other blockchains if the popularity and the demand is there. 

If I remember correctly #Solana was sitting around 18 dollars per coin for quite some time before completely going parabolic after $BONK got airdropped to #SOL holders and coins like $WIF took off. Then it catapulted to the number #1 used blockchain for meme coins and now the price is almost $200 per coin as a result. (I guess nothing moves the needle like free money to your holders 😂)

That in-and-of itself played out the entire blueprint of what other blockchains need to do in order to get liquidity over to their chain and users to start bringing volume to their ecosystem. It played out right infront of everyone in real-time and we all witnessed it completely take over. 

There is no better example to follow.

We also saw a lot of hype around #Cardano last summer because of $SNEK. It was completely blowing up and people were starting to look at their ecosystem. Maybe even #Cardano can take some notes now out of the #Solana playbook for this bull cycle.

But after analyzing this, my thought became - what if this also happened with chains like #Avalanche and #Polygon? 🤔💭 

We saw a little movement on #Avalanche due to new meme coins recently but haven’t really heard much noise on #Polygon. My point is that the same thing can happen over hereas well. Meme coins can move the needle for #Polygon too, so I started looking for some top meme coins in the ecosystem. 

I’ve been looking at a few coins, among them was $GIB so I reached out and talked to the team. I’ve been talking to them for a few weeks now and the core team there seems like they have their priorities in the right place and a growing community which is why I decided to partner and work with them. 

I believe they could really help move the needle for #Polygon and bring in new investors and holders just like #Solana meme coins did for their chain - you just have to be ahead of the curve this time.

Think about it like this - #Polygon is a Top 15 crypto with a $10 billion dollar market cap - with a strong foundation, tech and partnerships lined up. It’s only a matter of time before they take a page out of the #Solana playbook and meme coins start taking off over there too - and when they do they’ll be flying fast. 

Front run the liquidity, front run the countless new users and front run the hype and the FOMO. I would grab at least a few of the top meme coins over there to be ahead of the curve and I can promise you $GIB is one of them. 

Happy meme coin season! 🔥🚀

I'm starting to see the $QNT ERC20 FUD again...

So let me say this for the 14,881,364th time, once for each QNT token.

The ERC20 standard for QNT is purely so that it's accessible on a public permissionless chain.

They've chose Ethereum as it's stood the test of time and is regarded as the most well known blockchain with smart contract support.

But as we know, Overledger isn't even a blockchain hence why they've created QRC20 smart contract.

As once you move onto Overledger, the standards of ERC20 no longer apply, rather you will operate under the token standard of Overledger, QRC20.

This enables multi-chain interoperability and deployment of assets.

We've already seen this in action with the first public project utilizing Overledger in Galileo $LEOX.

Their vision in tokenizing the luxury space is one that calls for the needs of multi-chain capabilities, as brands will be looking to create DLT agnostic access of these branded goods in pNFT form.

The LEOX token is not only QRC20, but their NFTs are QRC721, which is the NFT standard on Overledger.

Once again, this enables agnostic interoperability of NFT assets onto multiple blockchains... Essential to the future operations of Galileo.

So what happens IF Ethereum goes down?

This has ironically been a growing concern with the ERC20 FUD, it's ironic because Ethereum has still yet to show any signs of network failure.

Sure, one could argue the network is terrible to use due to the insane amounts of gas fees & I would agree.

But the point about Ethereum standing the test of time still certainly stands & is why QNT continues to live on the Ethereum blockchain today.

But hypothetically if something were to happen, just keep in mind the operations on Overledger aren't even on Ethereum.... It's not even on a blockchain.

It just so happens that blockchains are one of the technologies that can interoperate in their network.

The operations are on Overledger & in return the team could easily convert QNT onto another blockchain within the same day.

Finally onto one last bonus point to further counteract the FUD of QNT tokens.

There is often concern of what the token is used for on Overledger & here below we can see Quant themselves had directly answered this.

Similar to Ethereum or any other L1 that has a native gas token, QNT also serves as the fuel to Overledger.

This is in combination with QNT also being used as a form of tokenized licenses & security for gateways in the near future.

Though the biggest differentiator here is that users don't have to directly pay in QNT.

Rather they can simply pay in fiat, which ensures a much more seamless process than sending crypto tokens from a wallet.

Simply pay with a debit/credit card and the fiat is converted to QNT in such a seamless manner that you're thinking you're paying with fiat!

Well, technically you ARE paying with fiat.

The people saying "token not needed" are indirectly COMPLIMENTING how seamless Quant's made their solution.
The most significant innovation in crypto since Ethereum is $ICP The Internet Computer. Fully on-chain is the real deal.

Every Alt Coin has a half-life relative to #Bitcoin like radio-active decay. 

It's either Pump and Dump e.g. Ethereum

Or it's Pure Dump e.g Algorand

Some people will argue for #Bitcoin only from moral perspective. I'm not going to.

There’s Pyth Data all around you 🔮

Today, the Pyth Network welcomes @ambient_finance as the newest data provider to the oracle network.

Launched in 2023, Ambient has become a leading DEX on @Blast_L2, @Scroll_ZKP, @ethereum, and @CantoPublic.

Learn more about our partnership below:

ℹ️ About Ambient

Ambient is a decentralized exchange (DEX) protocol that allows for two-sided AMMs combining concentrated and ambient constant-product liquidity on any arbitrary pair of blockchain assets.

Ambient runs the entire DEX inside a single smart contract, where individual AMM pools are lightweight data structures instead of separate smart contracts.

This feature, along with other design decisions, makes Ambient the most efficient Ethereum-based DEX.

🗣️ Quotes

"We are excited to leverage our market data to support the Pyth Network ecosystem. By providing pricing data from our deep, liquid pools, we look forward to increasing security, efficiency, and transparency in financial data on-chain. As Ambient grows we look forward to providing market data for more assets, and playing a role in the growth of the Pyth Network." — Doug Colkitt, Founder of Ambient Finance.

Last weekend @VitalikButerin sat on a “future of Ethereum is L2s” panel with $METIS co-founder Yuan Su

Today, he sat front row as Metis co-founder Elena Sinelnikova spoke at length about Metis’ long-term vision

Need I also remind you that Vitalik’s Mum is literally an advisor to the METIS team?

It’s simply a matter of time my friends…
Stellar overtook Ethereum in tokenization of US Treasury….  It can easily fill the void of Ethereum.

BlackRock's Ethereum-based tokenized fund BUIDL enjoyed strong demand in its first week, attracting $245 million in deposits.
https://t.co/4TFhDLfVBx

The difference of research and development of Ethereum 2015-2018 vs after ETH PoS is completely different, and it changed for the worst.

Earlier, there was so much optimism and drive for creation, more features, more scaling, parallel execution, sharding, resolving governance, fixing privacy, and now, we read that L1 does not have to move fast anymore and it could rely on L2 development. Security is pushed towards account abstraction or wallets, SC safety is outsourced to auditors, tests. And nobody is tackling the existing problems of reentrancy, wallet drains, math problems.

It is clear that if Ethereum would do better, the whole crypto world would be in a better place, and I try to find ways in which Ethereum should move forward, but it is more than clear that there is no real thinking about developing it further, or to acknowledge problems. When Ethereum started it wanted to be the internet computer, a general computation layer to run anything. With the new direction, it only wants to notarise blobs. I fairly think if someone create a system specially for this, it will be much better. I think the scope has been fairly reduce, and if you want to become more than a financial chain, you need to increase the scope, not reduce.

The #blockchain as system has to reach its most optimal form and to create an environment where developers can really enjoy building. In EVM systems and with ERC tokens, with building on L2s and integrating bridges, it is not fun to develop, and it is also insanely expensive, as well as audits. How can a new developer leave in this kind of world?

It is more and more clear that L2 scaling is not scaling, you have the same applications, same DEXs, same teams deploying same contracts on multiple chains.  And it is put in the conclusions as well: "arhitect application so that it supports every L2". This is not something you would need to do in a scaling web2 ecosystem. You just create an application, deploy, and people can simply interact with it. 

In the current form I do not see a good future for this. It is all of a moneys game. It is clear that incentive wise, there are hardly any incentives to follow guidance of @VitalikButerin for creating better L2s - as there is no support yet for enshrined processes. It is most clear that there is little incentive to build any new feature on the L1 level, as noone is paying for that. It is more sexy to launch a new L2 which the same code, no innovation, and invite people to launch the same old applications. Fragmented liquidity, fragmented UX, fragmented apps, no composability.

There are a few questions in my mind seeing that the chain with most liquidity is not actually evolving: 

How could I help, starting from the position of what I learnt and from the position of #MultiversX ecosystem?

What about all the innovation happening in multiple places, how can those contribute to a better blockchain world?

#Ethereum You know why so many say I'm one of the smartest men in crypto? Because I teach you things no one else seems to know. People do arm chair economist calcs on price moves based on liquidity. They say, but people will sell. But they forget people often remove liquidity as well, which if price is moving up, is the same as removing sell pressure. But they're not smart enough to count things that make it easier for price to go up, only smart enough to count things which would hurt price... 

For some reason they also don't account for many people preferring to buy green candles instead of red, and many preferring to buy higher instead of lower. Yes it's really a thing. You could call breakout traders one of these types, you can also call people that hear about things last one of these types. There's also the fallacy of people confusing what you pay with what you get. If you've bought a $500+ T-shirt, you might notice, it ain't actually better.

Protip: Guessing is hard, and it's even harder when you leave out half the variables.

Not financial advice. Past performance is no guarantee of future.

I got asked how @LCX Earn generates the fixed yield on $BTC $ETH $EUR $LCX

LCX Earn is a tokenized bond denominated in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Euro and LCX Token issued by LCX AG - the company behind LCX. The bond is endorsed (official word for approved) by the Financial Market Authority and officially available in 30 European Countries. 

LCX AG has 1 million CHF share capital, publishes risk and financials disclosures, is headquartered in Liechtenstein - a highly reputable country with a AAA rating by Standard & Poor’s.

It works like any corporate bond issued by MicroStrategy, BMW or Deutsche Bank. Yield is provided and generated by the company. LCX is highly profitable. Guaranteeing this fixed yield is very predictable and paid by profits. Yield in particular for this product are generated via liquidity providing, staking or general business operations.

In the prospectus it says: “The proceeds from the issue will be used by the Issuer at its own discretion, but according to plan, in particular to increase the liquidity and the trading volume on the platform of LCX AG, to continue to operate and expand the LCX platform  (trading platform for cryptocurrencies), furthermore to advance the development of products and procedures for the settlement and securing of trading transactions in the area of cryptocurrencies and the development of cryptocurrencies, as well as to implement further approval procedures before the Liechtenstein
Financial Market Authority. However, if
necessary, the proceeds of the issue will also be used for only one of the aforementioned purposes.”

Note: Investment Period for LCX Earn was 12 month and is closed at the moment. We will extend and re-open the investment period after regulatory approvals. Follow @LCX to keep updated. 

Btw; having a 3 letters twitter X handle is so special. 👏 to L C X

We are Veterans ⚔️

Veterans are a tribe of survivors. They are anyone that has been here since the beginning of Solana. Anyone that has stuck through the various trials and tribulations of Solana as we all have. Anyone that continues to fight for what we believe in even when the outlook was dark.

This month, we are honored to have our art, technology, and community finally come to fruition.

Jupuary will be a crucial time to decide who will be a part of the nation of the Veterans. As our mint nears, we have many surprises to share with all of our troops:

🎖️ Through the E7L-S technology we bring to Solana, NFT drops will be given to holders who achieve certain merits throughout time.

🎖️ With our various collaborations, there will be traits that provide exclusive benefits such as token airdrops to their holders upon mint.

🎖️ A number of Veterans will be inscribed directly on chain. Veterans will be the first collection to
incorporate inscriptions this way into a mint.

🎖️ Our Veterans Art Factory led by our art & design team will help bring artists from Web2 into Web3 to share their work with us and the ecosystem.

More information on all of these topics will be released soon. And with it, a very unique collaboration to commemorate this new Saga on Solana.

The era of Veterans is approaching. You have reached the door of our base after a harsh winter. We are proud to have you join our ranks.

Shoulder to shoulder, we will fight for glory! 🗡️

Yesterday's flash crash was a blessing in disguise for us since we got to see the risk engine working in all its glory. 
We witnessed:
1. Solana dropping more than 22% in less than 5mins and onchain priority fees going so high that pyth started missing some slots to publish yet flash allowed every trader to close position using its backup oracle system that kicked right in time. 
2. Depegging of USDC for few seconds and the protocol started quoting low price for usdc in time while selling usdc back in market at $1 
3. Total flush of OI at Flash settled with zero bankruptcies 
4. Liquidator bot efficiently liquidated all positions without needing much bump in priority fees 

Interesting thing is during this crash binance went down too, so it wasn't a normal day and flash being a novel protocol worked flawlessly giving us the signal to bring in the liquidity🌊🌊

Some misunderstand my post about capital flowing from Solana to Sei. Allow me to explain👇

Solana is infinitely greater in all metrics than Sei rn. TVL, users, onchain activity etc. This is an apples and oranges comparison. I’m not calling for a Sei flip of Solana. Thats an extreme outlier situation. Anything is possible but it’s unlikely.

Solana comes off such a huge base. It’s now established. Just like Ethereum did last cycle when Solana creeped up on it and attracted some of its liquidity. I I see Sei doing the same to Solana this cycle. It didn’t take alot of capital to move the needle of the Solana ecosystem last cycle and I think the same will be true with Sei this cycle.

Sei is first out of the gate with the hottest L1 narrative this cycle - parallelized EVM. Which should allow it to attract even more capital from the Ethereum ecosystem. Which is infinitely larger than Solana even.

What’s important to note is that during last cycle SOL ended up doing a 300x vs a 10x for ETH. Of course this is risk adjusted. It’s infinitely riskoer to be in SEI vs SOL rn. Same as it was to be in SOL vs ETH last cycle.

I’ve placed my bets accordingly. Everybody should do the same based on their own risk tolerance and growth expectations. One thing is certain in crypto, things can get crazy quick. I try to be ahead of this craziness.

But I also think in Sei’s case we’re nowhere near a cycle top. That’s a mistake I made last cycle not realizing how early we actually are in a new powerful narrative as ct is ultimately an echo chamber. And if they aren’t even talking about something yet in the mainstream media you can’t possibly say the top is in. Still early. Still long. Nfa.

Will graciously take the L if Ansem top ticked this one. I’ll respectfully (he’s been very sharp) take the other side and say we go higher across the entire Sei ecosystem.🫡

This is one of the main reasons I am bearish Solana: top thought leaders are trolls and/or idiots, and their followers have no idea about it and will like and RT whatever nonsense they are tweeting about.

Here are a couple of quick examples:
Anatoly went from claiming $ETH should become a layer 2 for $SOL, to asserting that $SOL is already layer 2 for $ETH.

Mert, who is a Solana dev and appears to be a top influencer for it,  does not understand basic principles about crypto and aggressively responds to posts with double standard takes and ad hominem attacks.

Neither of them could give a straight answer about what Solana's historical TPS record is. SOL's maximum TPS was seen during the last bull cycle when it was processing about 6.5k TPS at moments. However, that includes both execution and consensus trxs. I asked Mert what he thought the "consensus overhead" was during those peaks, but he responded by saying he had no idea about what meant by "consensus overhead". 

Mert also suggested that ETH rollups will be more attractive if deployed on top of new parallelized EVM L1s like Monad (even though they are designed to have plenty of headroom on L1 and only a minute fraction of ETH's network effects).

Having thought leaders and their respective communities parroting this level of idiocy is bearish as fuck, and it reminds me of HEX.

just discovered a huge meme tokens farm on @solana that makes thousands $SOL per day, here's some investigation and proofs 👇 (not a classical liquidity rug pull)

It was 2AM, I was poking at @jito_sol bundle explorer and randomly found a very interesting bundle containing transactions in the following sequencing:
- create liquidity pool on raydium for meme token
- buy meme tokens for X $SOL from account A
- buy meme tokens for Y $SOL from account B
- buy meme tokens for Z $SOL from account C
- send jito tip

So basically, this user launches a token, adds liquidity, and get first 3 buys, user always buys first and always gets the lowest price, since suspect uses jito bundles that has the following gurantees:
- transactions in a bundle and they are guaranteed to execute in order
- bundles execute atomically within the same slot
- bundles can only contain successful transactions. If any transaction in a bundle fails, no transactions in the bundle will make it on-chain

Some bundle proofs:
https://t.co/Oat7GAIDbT (He made >300 $SOL profit from this one)
https://t.co/CaAUZ4AT59
https://t.co/xkvd8tutOg

It was hard to find out how many tokens were created by this farm, but I've randomly pasted one of their wallets in one of the tg channels that monitors new pools and I was shocked(see video in next tweet), he launches tokens every 10 minutes(!). Every of them has a twitter, telegram channel, website, unique logo, description and so on. Every token looked like a complete conveyor belt.
Here's examples of such tokens:
https://t.co/Y8OIA4AdM5
https://t.co/ObDLsDYMY7
https://t.co/0XbsxiVA89

Why do I think same person created all meme tokens of this kind?
- all tokens share the same pattern
- same wallets are always the first buyers and top holders
- wallets doesn't spam any other tokens
- no classical liquidity rug pull, but more sophisticated selling
- high jito bundle price, he definitely doesn't want anyone else to win the auction

What I didn't understood is the why he uses CPI in his custom on chain program to perform raydium swap in buy transactions. Last instruction invokes program GzHeu1BN5gVTptHfgG7M97h4MbXASpFAJ9kCpLwfbbFs which invokes raydium amm program.  Here's tx example: https://t.co/jdpsLeKJvZ
(please lmk if you know why)

These positions update in real time, without the need to manually refresh.

$SONIC #SOLANA https://t.co/2UkImhQrdG

In the past couple years Solana witnessed the birth and rise of 2 insane monsters in the NFT marketplace space and what excites me the most about it is that both of them are still tokenless and we as community are going to cook off that opportunity

Tensor is undoubtedly one of Solana's best flagship and success story with a small passionate team of people leading their way into becoming a clear market leader with over 75% of Solana's NFT volume happening on their platform as we speak, pushing the boundaries of the OPOS narrative and building the exact platform we degens asked for

Magic Eden on the other side is a great example of embracing new frontiers and never stopping going that way even when the vision was harder to see for the outsiders, feels like even though they lost their Solana marketshare I think they are pretty happy with the outcome on the Bitcoin side of things where they clearly became the go-to marketplace for Ordinals trading, they also raised an insane $130M just 18 months ago, basically having a bigger war chest than some of your favorite L1s

I suspect that Magic Eden will try and gain Solana's market back from Tensor this year and I don't think there are many other ways to do it than with incentives, so not only I expect a token from Tensor but I also do expect one from Magic Eden too

I talked about ways of getting exposure to $TNSR many many many many times but never talked about $MAGIC so here we are: 

Magic Eden has a live loyalty program on Solana that earns you diamonds that are basically just points, 1 SOL of actual volume on the platform is giving you 8 diamonds, you can also claim 2 free diamonds per day everyday just by logging onto Magic Eden (this one might be good for my low capital farmers just saying)

Personally i'm mostly using Magic Eden on Bitcoin so even though we don't actually accrue diamonds on Bitcoin I still expect the team to make it right for their current main customers in case they launch a token

Magic Eden also has a NFT collection called Magic Tickets that has been live for years on Solana now and was airdropped back in February 2022 to active users of the platform, it's a $10M market cap collection at current prices and considering Tensorians are at $100M market cap frog decided to accumulate a bag from 1.6 to current prices around 2.25, please note that while Tensorians have an explicit usecase in the Tensor points system Magic Eden never ever announced anything regarding Magic Tickets so it's a very speculative bet with no actual fundamental thesis than: 

- $TNSR x $JUP cope will be so insane from missooors that they will ape anything with a tiny bit of airdrop narrative to offset the cope (others collections could also fit here)
- Once again Magic Eden raised $130M (!! still shocked at this number ngl)
- Only way to get speculative exposure to Magic Eden
- 10:1 ratio in market cap between Tensorians and Magic Tickets, there's must be a balance somewhere in the middle

I'm planning to get out over time as market slowly opens its eyes to the thesis above

Also let me answer a question I get asked quite a lot, is frog stopping $TNSR farming after the airdrop and TGE? 

The answer is no, Tensor knows that incentives have to keep going in order to retain whales/users/volume and I don't know if they are going the @weremeow x JUP route and setting 50% of tokens aside for the community but I do expect them to airdrop only a partial batch of the supply reserved for community incentives at the end of Season 3 and keep going like Blur for another couple seasons at least, I mean there's no way they don't do it this way so I'm definitely going to keep grinding the leaderboard in order to get my bi-annual stimmy from Tensor after the end of Season 3 while most people move on to the next shiny farm

Anyway, frog as always is enjoying the best of both worlds while most likely getting nicely rewarded on both sides

🧵 Solana 0-1 for Beginners

Solana is 3800x faster than Ethereum, 10,000x faster than Bitcoin

w/ fees @ pennie's or lower

Step 1: download a Solana wallet, the most used are Phantom(https://t.co/uAxgGHvBuz) or Solflare(https://t.co/OsAHOK2MJ9)

Step 2: fund your wallet, you can do this from a CEX such as Coinbase or Binance, or through a bridge like Allbridge(https://t.co/HAebQ6lkX2) if you have funds on a different blockchain

Step 3: decide what you want to do onchain, Solana is ripe with active development in many areas, here are a few:

-staking/validating (@jito_sol, @MarinadeFinance, @marginfi)
-nfts (@MagicEden)
-trading(@JupiterExchange)

Step 4: find your community, there are plenty of people exploring and building on Solana, either on X or Telegram. 

be weary of people who are getting paid for promo or using their followers for exit liquidity. if someone is shilling a new ticker every hour and the chart(https://t.co/gCzX8AoDAZ) goes down immediately after, stay away. 

Always make sure you are checking URLs and transactions before you interact to avoid any malicious activity.

if you found this helpful, welcome and enjoy the most accessible and user friendly chain in crypto🫡

I like these @sagamonkes, but even moreso I like what they represent.

I've never been a chain maxi (cuz it's stupid) but before a cpl months ago I had only ever bought nfts on eth.

But when I heard @killabearsnft was teasing an expansion to Solana, I decided to bridge some ETH over and check it out.

What I didn't know at the time was... a simple journey into jpegs, quickly turned into a dive deep down the rabbit hole 🐇

Into the incredible story of a resilient, die-hard, passionate community.

A community who got giga-rugged by a raging sociopath, while much of the broader crypto community shit on them, clowned them, wrote them off, and left them for dead.

And not only did this community survive, they shipped. 

All throughout the bear. Setting themselves up to be positioned as perfectly as possible when the inevitable turn in the market happened.

And now, here we are.

To those who believed, this is no surprise. @blknoiz06 was pounding it into everyones' heads day after day (wish I listened earlier, ser!)

And because of their work, grit, and resilience... this time around when the real normie money comes back in, 

I believe SOL will be their gateway.

Bonk and WIF will onboard them, just like Doge and Shib in cycles past.

They will see good UI/UX, fast and cheap transactions, and  a plethora of ponzinomic pleasures to suit any risk appetite.

And they will come in through the phones which were never supposed to succeed, yet just sold more preorders in 1 day than v1's entire year of sales...

Which brings us back to @sagamonkes - dropped for free to Saga holders at a very pivotal time in Solana's short, but storied history.

A few simply placed pixels, which represent the triumphant journey of the underdog who was left for dead, and came back to life even stronger.

Even the great @aeyakovenko rocks one as his pfp.

Huge shoutout to all the manlets. Have met some great and incredibly smart people since I came into the ecosystem. 

Especially enjoying @0xMert_'s hilarious responses to the sol haters too. (and shout to @Lightspeedpodhq for putting out some incredible content)

It's clear what's happening here on SOL is something great, and I'm excited to dive deeper into the eco, and for the rest of the Killabears community to experience it.

Because we too know what it's like to be underestimated, and overcome adversity too. So I think we'll fit right in over there.

If you're wondering what's next on the Airdrop menu:

I have very high conviction in @tensor_hq being a tremendous cook, and rumor has it they time their $TNSR launch with @JupiterExchange for max Solana liquidity injection [could be wrong]

While Solmaps got nerfed by 75%, they could still be the most +EV play. Price still somewhat stable, volume still sky-high, 0 royalties

Apart from that, focus on:

- Low royalty fees
- Top 20-30 Collections / High volume
- 'Price stable' collections

E.g. the Parcl NFT might be a good candidate to farm Tensor points, crossing off all boxes.

I'm staking a Tensorian, so my ref gives you 5% bonus points in perpetuity: https://t.co/kIuN5pCEuH
----------------------

I also have a good feeling towards @PolyhedraZK and @wormholecrypto. The former is quite controversial; my conviction is entirely based off intuition. OKX campaign has  ≈30K participants – sounds familiar?

Can't go wrong with other interoperability solutions either: LayerZero, Jumper, deBridge, Bungee, maybe Orbiter

There's definitely market-wide demand for them given recent Across and Connext price action.

Sure, @LayerZero_Labs is the most botted and farmed Airdrop since inception  [closely tailing behind zkSync], but it's still rather easy to push into Top 300k by simply being consistent, hitting a lot of S/D chains, and pushing volume.

And LayerZero might unironically launch at +20B FDV, so there's plenty of governance power to be distributed. 

My Airdrop Strategy has always been to get my hands into as many pies as possible; this way I ensure to never miss out.

Solana is coming for enterprise with token extensions

Token extensions allow customization around the SPL token standard:

- Privacy features (don’t show amt, sender, etc)
- If-this-then-that logic (e.g. automatically forward 5% of the txn value to this address)
- Revoke capabilities (allows a given signer to revert any txn involving said token)

As a manlet myself, I'm loving Solana's execution and strategy: 

- Monolithic (own the whole stack) set up allows them to move extremely fast and coordinated
- Strong BD team allows them to form partnerships and solicit feedback from tech giants such as Visa / Shopify
- Eng team actually ships and delivers on features that address needs and pain points

It's clear they are pushing their advantages hard to carve out a niche and moat that other blockchains can't compete with as effectively

The last piece here is to get a well known enterprise user (such as Shopify) to adopt token extensions and make it crystal clear how much $ they save - solana txns are much cheaper than merchant credit card fees

I do wonder if Stripe is involved at all with this - it is so clear that they play a part as the inspiration for this feature 😅

the product implications of token extensions on @Solana are enormous! my two favorite ones are transfer hooks and confidential transfers

transfer hooks are powerful enough to create permissioned tokens on the permissionless @Solana network, including things like in-game gems (limit transfer to certain PDAs) or even contractually-enforced royalty splits

confidential transfers mean everyday usage of blockchain (payroll, merchant settlement) without exposing sensitive data

token extensions provide the ability to customize the nature of how tokens operate, with the safety and composability of the SPL Token standard.

"A night of regret"

The glow of the Beer Museum sign flickered overhead as we watched her from the shadows, a dame with trouble written all over her face. She stepped out into the misty night, her silhouette framed by the dim glow of the streetlight.

The air was thick with the scent of regret and spilled beer. She lit a cigarette, the flame casting a brief, fiery glow on her face, revealing eyes that had seen too much and lips that whispered secrets.

We approached her in the alley, the echoes of her breakup still lingering in the air like the last note of a sad jazz tune. She glanced our way, the haze of smoke adding an air of mystery to her sorrow.

"Bad night to drown my sorrows," she muttered, taking a drag and exhaling a cloud of smoke. We nodded, silently understanding that sometimes, in this city of broken dreams, the only solace one could find was in the bottom of a glass or the end of a cigarette.
