Next up to bat is a project we loved since the beginning. @myracoinonsol $Myra has been absolutely ripping since we had them on the show. We told you before it hit a million that this was on our radar. This project has since went multi-millions and is showing that she wants her space at the table with #Myro. 

It’s been a while since we’ve had our friends on @PepeCommunity_ $Pepe from #ETH on and we are pumped to have a 2x Pepe #space. The “People’s Pepe” went to 60 million months ago and has been steadily building as we enter the bull. Join us for an update on this top project of 2023.

We couldn’t miss an opportunity to unite @SolanaPepecoin $Pepe with Pepe on #Ethereum. #Pepe on Solana have absolutely been snapping necks this week and headlined our Thursday show. We are so proud of this community that we helped pioneer since the beginning. Join us to enjoy a double dose of Pepe.

We are pumped to have @OP_CATETH $OPCAT on the show. Op_Cat was originally part of Satoshi’s code for Bitcoin. It was removed in 2010 due to security concerns, but with current developments may be revived in an effort to make #BTC more scalable and open up things for L2s and inscriptions on the chain. Join us to find out what these Quantum Cats are up to!

Next up is a very perculiar project. @NobodyElonERC20 $Nobody was one of two projects that resurrected recently out of no where. We saw $Troll go to the hundreds of millions in marketcap and the other one $Nobody was following until a rogue mod of their Telegram caused massive fear. Since then, the leader of #Troll helped recover the TG and is now helping #Nobody as a sister project of Troll. Join us as this story unfolds for this Elon narrative.

You guys already know the mighty @satellitedoge1x #Doge1 project. They stopped by at a few hundred thousand marketcap and absolutely exploded. This project has reached the multimillion MC and has it’s eyes set to the heavens as the Doge-1 space launch grows closer. Come check the guys out as we chop it up and get excited about this red hot Elon narrative.

@MarvinOnEth $Marvin is a project we definitely have a soft spot for. After a very promising start, their dev stunted momentum by abandoning the project and Telegram. Since the. The community has dug in to build something real and continues to support in a big way. Don’t fade a community that doesn’t quit.

We introduced @BlackRocketERC $V69 on our show on Thursday. This microcap with cypherpunk meets Aeon Flux vibes continue to build. We are pumped to see what this project is capable of as it’s first week of life concludes. Join us to see what these guys are doing and a update on their growth.

Our “Lucky Last”project is @SBWMickeyERC $Mickey has absolutely been a mainstay on #ETH this January.  As IP rights for Steamboat Willy’s variation of Mickey became public domain, this DeFi project became the first entity not named Disney to use this classic cartoon. They have since built an amazing community and continue to stay relevant in the trends. Our “Lucky Lasts” have uncanny good luck if you check our episode backlog @K1dandWalt. We expect #Mickey to continue that trend.

Forget GameStop Stock, Now There's A GameStop Memecoin And It's Worth Millions

A GameStop memecoin on @solana, using the same $GME ticker, is trying to repeat the feat, running up to over $14 million in market capitalization within the first 24 hours.

What Happened: 
A Solana-based Gamestop memecoin catapulted to a peak market capitalization of over $14 million within 24 hours of its launch.

On its website wallstsucks . lol, the memecoin bills itself with the slogan "Wall St. Can't Stop It Now" and makes the direct connection that "$GME on Solana is a tribute to the GameStop saga."

The token exploded after its launch but lost over 85% of its value after its X profile was banned. 

It has since recovered to a market cap of around $6.5 million and secured a listing on the centralized cryptocurrency exchange Poloniex.

Why It Matters: 
The $GME memecoin follows the recent trend of fast-moving Solana memecoins surging to astronomical valuations in no time.

What's Next: 
Whether the GameStop token has the same staying power as its dog-themed companions remains to be seen.

It's remarkable how the $ALPH team is in stealth mode pioneering features that would be considered groundbreaking in established Layer 1 (L1) protocols like Ethereum, Cardano or Solana.

The introduction of 'Gasless Transactions' is a paradigm shift. This breakthrough is revolutionary, offering developers the means to create Web3 applications that provide a seamless, Web2-like user experience. 

It eliminates a significant barrier for average users ('normies'), who will no longer need to grapple with even the minimal gas fees currently required. By allowing developers to absorb these costs, Alephium is paving the way for a more inclusive and user-friendly blockchain ecosystem. This feature is a game-changer in its own right, adding to Alephium's already impressive suite of functionalities. 

The trajectory of the $ALPH team is not just incremental; it's transformative. They're charting a course that extends well beyond the capabilities of other L1 protocols. 

At this rate, Alephium is quietly positioning itself at the forefront of blockchain innovation, setting a pace that others will struggle to match, let alone maintain. 

@alephium is 'for now' the best kept secret in crypto 🤫

Intro to Stake-weighted QoS (Quality-of-Service) in  @solana 

🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀

Stake-weighed QoS (Quality-of-Service) is an implementation feature which, when enabled, allows leaders (block producers) to identify and prioritize transactions proxied through a staked validator as an additional sybil resistance mechanism.

Proof-of-Stake (PoS) networks use the signaling mechanism of stake (funds dedicated to a Validator) as a signal of the quality of that Validator (thus the term Quality of Service), helping to prioritize it's transactions for block inclusion. 

Unlike Validator nodes (aka consensus nodes, voting nodes, staked nodes), RPC nodes (aka unstaked nodes, non-voting nodes) don't gain the benefits associated with stake-weighting when it comes to transaction priority by way of a leader's TPU (transaction processing unit).

With Stake-weighted QoS, Validator nodes can extend a "virtual stake" to their RPC node peers (provided that Validators have added a "--staked-nodes-overrides" stake_map and peer RPC nodes have implemented "--public-tpu-forwards-address <IP_ADDRESS_OF_VALIDATOR>"). 

This enables transactions from RPC nodes to get bossed up. SWQoS provides stake-weighted priority to 80% of a leader's TPU capacity. 

Such "peering arrangements" can be formed by operators who are running both Validator and RPC nodes manually through configuration settings. It is expected that exchanges might also find this feature useful to implement as they often operate both RPC and Validator nodes.

One potential benefit of implementing Stake-weighted QoS could be realized if certain agreements between Validators and RPC nodes are in place. RPC nodes may land more transactions in blocks by agreeing to peer with Validators, and Validators may sell more capacity to RPC nodes. These agreements must be made directly between RPC operators and Validators (in meatspace, afk).

With Stake-weighted QoS enabled, a node holding 1% stake will have the right to transmit *up to* 1% of the packets to the leader. In this way, nodes with higher stake are guaranteed to receive higher quality of service which prevents lower-quality nodes (with less at stake) from maliciously flooding out these transactions, increasing overall Sybil Resistance.

Forgive me if I got a few details wrong, still in my Solana ramping process here @anza_xyz :)

Solana is "NOT" going through the 2017 Ethereum ICO hype cycle . These takes are absolutely wrong — based in human desire to pattern match — like seeing faces in clouds.

If you were around in 2017, you know those ICOs were ideas at best — and the Ethereum technology was no where near ready to support them — heck, it is still not ready.

Solana is getting attention despite Ethereum being the black hole of crypto attention. It is because the devs are delivering.

1. dePIN is unlocked because of micropayments
2. frictionless trading is unlocked because of low cost and low latency
3. Creator economy is unlocked because of micropayments because it allows creators to drop digital scraps to their fans / to be fans

In a nutshell, Solana is fighting to get attention vs Ethereum — and it is able to do so because it is delivering on crypto’s original promise — peer to peer frictionless payments.

How to succeed trading shitcoins: A beginner's guide.

You Won't Miss The $BOME & $WIF On Solana If You Do All

@NotEezzy made a little long tweet on how to degen, which is very helpful, and I took my time to create a guide for newbies. 

1. Don't Fade Strength

Usually, when a chart looks bullish, there is a good reason for it. You don't want to fade a bullish looking chart because it was cheaper an hour ago. You can wait for a retracement or enter and DCA down but don't completely fade. 

2. Understand capital utilisation

The larger the market cap of a shitcoin, the more position or % of the token you should be holding

3. Volume is an act of value

You need to understand how well dips are eaten up when looking for reversals on dumps. You want to factor in its historical volume. If you are trading new pairs, you also want to be looking at the current volume. 

4. Take Profits

Considering the volatility of shitcoins, it's prudent to secure profits and at least recoup your initial investment within the first 2-4x gain. You can sell gradually as the price increases or based on chart signals of invalidation. Having a solid plan is essential.

5. Record or take note of everything

To accelerate your progress, document everything in a journal and spreadsheet. Use the spreadsheet to monitor your trades and the journal to note your emotions, reasons for trading, and key insights gained.

6. Be comfortable with losses

Initially, expect to incur losses as you begin trading. Accept this reality and proceed cautiously. If you feel anxious about a trade, it's likely that you've allocated too much capital.

7. Trade Less but research more

As you begin, avoid entering multiple trades simultaneously. Instead, proceed gradually and allocate more time to observing the price action of shitcoins. This process cultivates valuable experience and intuition, which are essential for success.

8. The missor 

It's impossible to catch every mooning opportunity. It's acceptable to miss out sometimes. I've made regrettable trades in the past by succumbing to revenge trading or FOMO after missing out. Learn from my mistakes and avoid repeating them. 

9. Low Volume weekends

On weekends (especially Sunday), volume is usually pretty low, so if you want to take a break, weekends are probably something to note. 

10. Find your expertise or what you love to do

Avoid attempting to do everything at once. Overextending yourself will likely lead to financial losses. Instead, focus on learning, and you'll discover that you excel in one specific type of play or strategy.

Work with what you are good at. There are many ways to make it in shitcoins. You don't have to learn all of them. Just learn one strategy well. 

11. Tools to use

Most importantly, get a telegram bot and sniper and a contract checker.  

12. DCA down

You don't have to ape all your bags at once. You can always DCA down while chart dumps. DCA won't work every time, but it is important and for a better entry.

13. Take Profits Out. The Most Out Of Crypto

Once you've made substantial profits, consider withdrawing some funds to improve your quality of life. Many people suffer losses because they reinvest their profits into larger trades, leading to eventual losses.

14. Understanding Liquidity Ratio To Marketcap

Consider the liquidity of a token relative to its market capitalization. Tokens with higher liquidity require more capital to push the price up. Having substantial liquidity is advantageous for entering trades with significant positions, as it minimizes slippage. Conversely, lower liquidity translates to lower trading volume.

Quadratic funding is coming to Solana with Cubik Grants Round 1 

What is it?
Cubik Grants is an initiative aimed to help public goods and open-source projects on Solana raise funds through community support based on the impact they create. These grant rounds will happen regularly, and Cubik Grant Round 1 will be the genesis round for this initiative.

How does it work?
The distribution of these grants uses a funding mechanism called Quadratic Funding, which matches additional funds based on every donation from the community in such a way that the project with the most support raises more funds.

Anyone who is building a project on Solana and is looking for some support can participate in these grant rounds. Just DM me, Grants Round 1 will start in the coming days.

ok seeing a lot of confusion on solana txns and fees still

if your txns aren't confirming, there are a few reasons for this:

i) you didn't add fees

ii) even if you did add fees, the current solana client is buggy and **a higher fee might not guarantee that your transaction lands**

read that again ^

iii) due to the randomness inherent in continuous block building and jittery networking / scheduling implementations — even if you increased your fee 10x, it still might not make it, very very important to understand

so don't increase your fee 10x, you just need to be above median, which is generally super low

"if I add higher fee I will be accepted faster" is not a correct way of thinking about this

iv) this is being largely addressed in Solana 1.18 (should be going live around april 1st)

v) during very high congestion periods, leaders might start shedding public RPC connections and start prioritizing staked connections — most of you shouldn't actually need this unless you are very sensitive on confirmation times (we've found this can reduce confirmation times by about 4-5x in prod and have a staked validator service for very serious users)

vi) you can experiment with durable nonces if you don't need instant finality 

vii) finally, we come to "it's the rpc's fault"

when is it the rpc's fault? well, if the geo-distribution of the rpcs is poor and you didn't add fees, you might get blockhash expired errors since speed to block leader matters

(also if the retry queue is flooded)

we have an open source txn-sender that can help you with this if you wanna play around (we've noticed that we get much lower confirmation times than other rpc providers):  https://t.co/MoWh3tvX0U

in any case, this stuff is pretty confusing atm and we are around 24/7 (like actually) to help you out — just msg us on tg, slack, or discord (or just tag me on twitter)

Solana people, you'll feel right at home

A) On Solana, we store data in Program Derived Addresses (PDAs). For each conversation, we create two PDAs: one for the sender and one for the receiver. Each party can send messages to their respective PDAs. We use AES encryption to secure these messages and store the hashes on the blockchain. When a user connects to our UI, the messages are decrypted using an API. We store timestamps for each message and fetch the entire conversation in sequence.
B) Indeed, fetching incoming and outgoing messages separately and merging them on the frontend is standard practice.
C) We enable Solana wallets to communicate with each other via voice or video using WebRTC. We use Livekit, a WebRTC service that includes a TURN server (https://t.co/IDcoJWRoOJ). Apologies for the confusion; it's TURN, not TUNE.
D) We employ a similar method to store images on IPFS as we do with messages. The images are public, but we store the Content Identifiers (CIDs) as hashes on the blockchain.
We are currently developing Solchat V2, which will include many additional features like group chats, group calls, NFT profile pictures, SNS, AllDomains, OTC trading, end-to-end encryption, message reactions, online status, and more. These features will be added to our roadmap as we continue to expand.

The narrative is realistic enough for retail to believe in it and even some whales.

This narrative does NOT need to be true, it just needs to exist for it to affect price.

A part of me may be crazy, but I actually think SOL could be the “ETH killer” lol.

However, I don’t necessarily WANT it to be the ETH killer nor care about this.

Even if there is a 30% chance of SOL being the ETH killer, this will be bullish.

The power of narratives and FOMO is real, but narratives don’t need to be.

We will start to see this more and more on our timelines: “ SOL will flip ETH”.

People will fomo into Solana and some ETH people will sell as a result of fear.

This is my prediction. I don’t care if I am right or not. I am publicly manifesting it.

I got love for both chains.

3 reasons why there is huge growth potential for CKB

1. CKB is the home for universal applications that can interact natively with existing wallets + keys from #Bitcoin,  #Ethereum, #Solana, #Cardano etc. Other chains cannot do this.

2. CKB is tied directly to state occupation. There is a natural demand driver for CKB: 1 byte of data stored on chain requires 1 CKB to be locked away. As adoption continues, more CKB is taken out of circulation.

3. CKB is future proof. Because it is cryptoagnostic, it isn't tied to one standard. It can adopt the newest standards easily. CKB can already implement quantum resistant protocols, or the latest FaceID standards supported by Apple/Google, or pretty much anything. This makes it best suited for mass adoption and long term relevance in the market.

tldr; CKB is in a league of its own. @NervosNetwork

Civic Pass is now integrated with @solana Token Extensions.

In case you’re not familiar with Token Extensions, they imbue tokens with a brand new set of features through some technical advancements.

One of these features is called a transfer hook, and it allows advanced permissioning to follow a token.

Using transfer hooks, we integrated Civic Pass with Token Extensions.

This means that identity credentials can now be referenced by a token along its journey through the ecosystem.

Information such as a location, age, humanity and government-issued ID may be used to control the token’s transfer rules via Civic Pass.

This unlocks all sorts of new possibilities for builders.

Here are examples of how Civic Pass x Token Extensions can be used:

RWAs. Issuers can ensure that only accredited investors can hold tokens.
Unconditional Basic Income (UBI) tokens. These social change tokens can be protected with Sybil resistance.
Live events. Airdrops, mints and DAO token issuances can be simplified. No more need to write smart contracts to protect against bots.

Exciting, right? This is just the start.

Let us know what you’re building with Token Extensions. We’d love to collaborate.

Check it out in our docs here: https://t.co/XRQnlpRuSy

SovereignChains at the power X.

A complete interoperability layer between #MultiversX and all the prominent ecosystems. Technically speaking SovereigChains will become L2s on Bitcoin, Ethereum, and will create bridgeless connections to Solana, Cosmos (IBC, ZKIBC) and others. Complex settlements being done in towards the connected chains.

But this will be more, and the hint here is our ability to run multiple VMs in parallel in the same SovereignChain with direct composable actions between executors, all leveraging a higher module. We also have the examples with EVM already working.

A well designed architecture, where you can run, launch and interoperate between multiple VMs, deploying any dApp for any language. Furthermore, it also means interoperability between tokens as well.

Imagine deploying products from EVM/SVM/Cosmos/other chains on a SovereignChain and have those interact with already existing and new products from the MultiversX ecosystem. Be it tokens, NFTs, socialFi, games, DeFi.

Now that market has sobered up some, some thoughts:
-L2 experience is now much better post Dencun. Obvious if you try
-Solana experience has degraded. Lots more failed txs. Fee markets still very broken. Hope the changes they're pushing in a couple weeks make a difference. TBD what happens with mempool, something to watch, and you should learn about MEV (you won't, which is fine with me)
-memecoins bubble prone but clearly unsustainable. 20 IQ zoomers will go through phases of buying, then get skinned alive by insiders/pro traders. 
-Presale meta (people being very stupid) + hearing things like "very conservatively will 5-10x" "infinite money glitch" type things -> usually portends tides turning
-bull markets have often followed this basic shape where each subsequent peak is marked by overconfidence/overlevering that gets flushed out
-bottoms often marked by exceedingly bearish targets (overconfidence in the other direction)

A New Era: The Killaverse Solana Expansion Begins Tomorrow 🐻

Tomorrow begins an exciting new chaper in the @killabearsnft saga! 

The day we take our first step toward expanding our onchain presence, by opening the bridge that will send our beloved Killacubs to the Solana network.

Dr. Fomo and Agent 827, will be leading the charge on a mission to explore the vast expanse of Planet SOL.

To join them on this thrilling journey, you'll need to get your Solana wallet ready for action. (You can use any wallet, but we recommend Phantom)

How To Set Up Your Phantom Wallet 👻

1️⃣  Install the Phantom Wallet Browser Extension

Visit the official Phantom wallet website (https://t.co/SJSxOnxwsm) and click on the "Download" button. Choose the browser extension that corresponds to your preferred web browser (Chrome, Firefox, or Brave). Follow the installation instructions provided by your browser.

2️⃣ Create Your Phantom Wallet Account

Once the extension is installed, click on the Phantom wallet icon in your browser's toolbar. Click on "Create New Account" and follow the prompts to set up your wallet. Make sure to securely store your secret recovery phrase, as it will be needed to restore your wallet in case of any issues.

3️⃣ Fund Your Phantom Wallet

To bridge your Killacubs to Solana, you'll need to have some SOL (Solana's native token) in your Phantom wallet to cover transaction fees. 

You can swap ETH for SOL using Synapse: https://t.co/40yMjkXoTA

Simply connect your ETH wallet and your new Phantom wallet and swap ETH to SOL

Alternatively, you can purchase SOL on various cryptocurrency exchanges and then transfer it to your Phantom wallet address.

4️⃣ Get Ready for the Galactic Portal Opening

With your Phantom wallet set up and funded, you'll be ready to bridge your Killacubs when the Galactic Portal opens tomorrow. You will have two options:

By following these steps, you'll be prepared to join Dr. Fomo and Agent 827 on their mission to Planet SOL. Stay tuned for more updates on the Galactic Portal opening and get ready to bridge your Killacubs to Solana!

The Galactic Portal Opens Tomorrow! 🌌 

With your Phantom wallet primed and ready, you'll be set to bridge your Killacubs when the Galactic Portal opens. 

Bridge: Simply bridge your Killacubs (and soon Killabears!) to Solana and explore this new world as you choose.

Staking (COMING SOON): Soon you'll also have the opportunity to stake your Cubs and Bears to participate in the ongoing SpaceSaga adventures. 

By staking, you'll also be eligible to win one of the coveted Killabears or Killacubs hidden within the SpaceSaga Rewards Vault!

The SpaceSaga Vault currently holds 25 Killabears and 35 Killacubs! 

More info on staking will be released soon.

Bridging Your Killacubs 🧸

When the Galactic Portal opens, follow these steps to bridge your Killacubs to Solana:

Connect your Phantom wallet to the Killacubs bridging platform. This will be on the official https://t.co/Lo7XDLfz6R website. Do not connect to anything that is not the official site.

Select the Killacubs you wish to bridge from your collection.

Confirm the transaction and pay the associated fees.

Once the transaction is complete, your Killacubs will be ready to explore Planet SOL!

The Future Of @killabearsnft & @killacubsnft On Solana 🪐

Expanding our ecosystem to @solana opens up a world of possibilities. Not only will you be able to buy, sell & trade your NFTs on a new blockchain, but you'll also have access to the vibrant Solana ecosystem.

There are many things we’ve wanted to build, but were handcuffed by the speed and transaction costs of the ethereum blockchain.

On Solana there are virtually no limits. We are finally able to bring our full-scale gaming experience to the ecosystem and community on both desktop and mobile. 

We’ve hired an additional full-time developer to continue increasing our speed, and ability to build innovative products and experiences.

We are working closely with the @solanamobile team to roll out our most successful games on the Saga Mobile dApp store. By having our Killabears and Killacubs available on Solana, this puts every single player of any of our games within just a few taps of entering the Killaverse!

This important first step leads us to a world of opportunity.

We believe in a multichain future, and for you to have the ultimate flexibility to buy, sell, trade, and interact with your assets. And it’s no secret Solana is the fastest growing network, and proving to be the choice for teams who are building for mass market audiences.

We are excited to be able to provide this opportunity for you. The team has been working around the clock to put everything into place so your experience with the bridge is smooth and easy.

We will announce the link in advance, and there will be no rush to bridge.

Controversial take that honestly really shouldn't be. But want to put on the table a topic that has been happening in many private conversations.

Solana is going to have and needs to have L2s and/or rollups.

I don't think these will manifest exactly like the Ethereum ecosystem, but there will always be app builders at scale that want more TPS, less competition for blockspace, lower fees, and that want to own more of the aggregate economics that their business generates.

It is insane that DRiP paid $10,000 in on-chain fees last week plus a plethora of other costs at the RPC level and in our cloud, not to mention the time rewriting our backend.

This is not a complaint, just an incentive-alignment problem that I'm not sure how to address at the base layer: The very apps that bring traffic and customers to the chain are rewarded with increased infra cost when the token appreciates in value, in part due to their efforts.

I think many app builders will be happy to make calculated decentralization tradeoffs to have favorable economics and TPS. And for users that want it, being able to pay extra to optionally secure their assets at the base layer makes tons of sense.

Please, read this is not as a criticism of our beloved chain. Simply as thinking about what needs to happen over the next few years to continue winning, from an app builder who is quite literally all in on Solana.
